review.title: OK hotel for an OK price
review.reviewText:
The Opal is a fine hotel for downtown SF. It's not great, it's not terrible. My ground floor room was very very noisy. Road noise, pedestrian noise, construction noise. I spend at least 25% of the year on the road and can do with some fairly noisy rooms. This was a bit too much. Noise from neighboring rooms and the hallway pretty loud too. That goes with the territory of older SF hotels mind you, nothing special there. Zero hot water was available the night I checked in, it was ok the morning after though.

Don't let the breakfast factor into your decision, it's some bread, toasters, and stale pastries. Plenty of great breakfast in the area that will be a little more filling.

Would I stay here again? Yea probably. The price was right and the city can get pretty expensive at times. Would I recommend it to someone on vacation? No. Spend a bit more and get something a little nicer.

review.title: Budget should not mean bad
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the opal with a group for business in June. We paid a huge price for the rooms, due to the over-inflation of SF and demand, due to a conference being in town.
My initial room (I was moved) was one of the worst I have ever stayed in. It smelt of stale tobacco (as did most of the hotel), the bed was lumpy, the shower underpowered, bathroom poorly lit, a/c didn't work properly and there was a large neon sign directly outside my window.
The hotel offered to change my room, but then had me out of my room at 10am and did not get me into a new room until 1pm. By which time, there was no hot water (which was not something mentioned when booking).
I understand that, when booking cheaper accommodation, you should expect less...but you should not expect little - there are budget hotels that do a lot for your money. This place did little. Avoid.

review.title: Built in early1900's; rooms updated 25 years ago
review.reviewText:
Room was moderate size with comfortable bed.  Bathroom extremely small.  Did have a/c and heat, but temp hard to control.  Throughout San Francisco, windows and doors are often left open for ventilation.  Without our knowledge, our room window was open the first night, making it very noisy.  Shutting the windows  helped a lot with noise, but the hotel is located on a busy street, so traffic could still be heard.  From reviews I read before choosing the Opal, hotel rooms are small and expensive in SF, so I would rate it as a good value for the room rate we paid. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly.   Marnie and Claudia at the front desk were extremely helpful and accomodating.  

Food- Limited Continental breakfast included and served at 6:00.   Fruit, cereal, boiled eggs, muffins, and toaster items, such as bagels, waffles, and English muffins.  Mel's Diner is attached and has extensive hours, but we found it to be expensive for the type and quality of food served.  Tommy's Joynt, which is just across the street, is a bar and restaurant, which looks unimpressive from outside, but the food was wonderful! The plate lunch ($12.88) is generous portions and was delicious!!!  (Corned beef, smoked brisket and turkey) Wish we had tried it earlier instead of Mel's when we needed to eat dinner near the hotel.  

The MUNI bus stops at the corner very near the hotel, which goes to Fisherman"s Wharf for about $1.00 one way. We found it convenient.

managementResponses.response: Bob: Thank you for your comments regarding your stay at The Opal. We can only get better when we listen to what our guests have to say. We are a 108 year old building going through a major face lift. I'm sorry you got put in a room with one of the older carpets. We have been putting new carpets in rooms and have installed new beds in all the rooms and I'm glad to see you got to experience one of those! I also appreciate your comments on our staff. They do work hard to make our guests' stays here as pleasant and comfortable as possible. We hope to see you again the next time you are in the city and we will try to get you in one of the renovated rooms!

review.title: Not upscale but Adequate
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a convention and tried to find an alternative to the $700/night hotels by the convention center. The Opal fit the bill. It's a tad on the old side and a bit threadbare though. There were cigarette burns in the carpet in my room, but no smell of cigarettes so I imagine it's from years ago. The carpet looked pretty old. The room was adequate but on the corner of two busy streets so it was noisy (at least with the windows up). The bathroom was cramped and the sink fixture required some serious muscle to turn on. However, the bed was comfortable, everything was clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. For a night or two it's just fine and 1/3 the price of the 5 stars downtown. All in about $250/night compared to $700. Anywhere but SF it would be $80. On a tight budget, I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace carpets, upgrade bathrooms

review.title: Mixed experience...
review.reviewText:
The online description does not adequately describe the rooms nor the amenities. The staff was nice. However, when we checked in no one talked about the $41/night parking PLUS taxes on the parking. We asked for a room on the 1st floor because my father-in-law is disabled. They only had a room on the 4th floor, but told us after that there was construction going on from 8am to 5pm on the 5th floor. The lobby was nice, but you had to be "buzzed" in to even check in (San Francisco thing?). The room was tiny but clean. They really need to work on adding additional signage inside to show where you are in relationship to the elevator/parking/lobby because it was super easy to get turned around. The exterior fire escapes that went right up to the windows freaked me out a little. Breakfast was included and the breakfast attendant was friendly/nice and kept everything tidy, but the selections were minimal. The location was convenient. My husband had to be seen at the VA hospital and it was super easy to get to and from the hotel. There's a nice, but way overpriced 50's style diner (Mel's Diner) attached that actually had a door from the lobby into the restaurant.
Overall experience was ok. I think I'd be willing to spend another $25-$30 to stay at a more updated hotel in the area next time around.

review.title: Gets the job done
review.reviewText: The Opal is everything you NEED, not everything you WANT. If you are visiting San Francisco for the first time and have the intentions of spending majority of your time, and only need a place to clean up and sleep without any real luxuries- this is the place for you. If you are the type to spend a good amount of time lounging in your room as well as out, you may want to consider another choice. For the price you will pay, it's about the best option there is. A few things to know about first time goers: You will be staying in the Civic Center area- meaning if your intent is to spend most of your time on the warf then you will be either walking for the better part of 45 minutes or public transit. This would not be so bad if it were not for the over population of homeless in the area- so good chances are that you will be sitting next to some interesting "characters". Would I stay there again? Yes, if I was trying to save money and only needed the bare necessities: SMALL bathroom, bed, tv stand ( which you can touch easily from laying in your bed), and desk. Honestly, next time around I will pay a few extra bucks and stay someplace closer. It wasn't a terrible experience- but it definitely wasn't the experience I anticipated when booking a reservation.

They even charge an extra 46 dollars a night if you actually need to park your car. There is nothing, but meters around the hotel, so parking is scarce. I also noticed there was a continental breakfast, but you'd probably save a bundle staying somewhere else and get a nice breakfast in a restaurant instead of this packaged deal. review.title: Charming Old World Charm with modern amenities
review.reviewText:
I have to premise this review with even though I am a seasoned traveler, I was not expecting the expense for hotel and possible parking a rental car for my first trip to San Francisco.  With that said, we were in San Francisco for a combination vacation/business trip.  After monitoring the hotel prices on Expedia for a month, The Opal had a sale on it's daily rates.  The location seemed central to everything we needed to do, so I booked.
Well, what a lovely surprise. for you traveler who prefer modern hotels, this is not the place for you; but if you love Old World Charm combined with central air conditioning, windows that actually open for fresh air, lots of towels and toiletries, and a perfect central location to almost everything, this is the place for you.  We stayed in room 327, which had a nice open bedroom area, and an off to the side sitting room. The bathroom was decent sized with hairdryer and toiletries.  Bathtub with shower. Our room was kept clean and fresh.  Included Breakfast Buffet was pretty standard, but just what we needed, as we ate our way through the plethora of dining opportunities the city offers for lunch and dinner.  The diner next door, Mels has a good hamburger and freshly made juices.

review.title: Nice Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: I'm not sure what all of these bad reviews are about, but I can assure you that not once did I experience any troubles with the staff or service at The Opal Hotel in San Francisco. Being a group of young 18 year olds, we were looking for somewhere cheap, but of course we didn't want to be getting some shack in the ditch. The Opal exceeded all of our expectations. Check in was a breeze, parking was much cheaper after the clerk led us to a parking garage down the street (keep in mind there are no in/out privileges for this one), and breakfast was perfect. It's not a 5-star meal, but it's nothing unbearable. The room was very clean, big enough for the 4 of us, and the bathroom was bigger than we expected. The hotel lobby was always comfortable and tidy, and the doors to get inside were only opened with a room key which made our stay feel even safer. As for the location, if you want to stay somewhere less sketchy, get the hell out of San Francisco b/c everywhere you go in the heart of a city is going to be "sketchy". Our stay was everything we could have imagined and more, with absolutely no troubles or complaints to leave behind. So please don't let these bad reviews sway your decision, this hotel is a lovely selection for a great price. And if you choose not to stay here, you're only leaving an extra room for myself when I return to this wonderful city.

review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, comfortable bed. Interesting people watching - lots of international travelers.
review.negativeRemarks: This is an old building, one elevator, I just use the stairs.

review.title: Charming hotel near our daughter & husband
review.reviewText: The city is expensive, especially if you're driving. We gave up and used the hotel's parking garage and discovered Uber, the very convenient and inexpensive pseudo cab company. The hotel staff were very friendly, especially the woman in charge of the breakfast area. We were blessed with great weather, especially the day we went to twin peaks for a magnificent view of the city. the de Young Museum was also a treat. Don't miss the free Observation Tower at the museum.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is a bit tired, but it has charm to mitigate that.
review.locationRemarks: Located on Van Ness and Geary, it's less than $10.00 by Uber to almost anything in the city.

review.title: Great stay in SF
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful.  Room clean and comfortable.  Great experience!

review.title: Walking distance to the Filmore
review.reviewText: The hotel room was spacious, clean, and comfortable.  We did NOT hear the traffic on Van Ness.  The parking lot was secured by a "garage door opener".
review.negativeRemarks: The complimentary breakfast was the usual disappointing motel standard menu, full of carbohydrates.

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText: The Opal was centrally located in San Francisco weekend vacation plans.

review.title: Very old and tired -shabby at best
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very old, very shabby and in a not too pleasant part of town. 
However the room was large, bedding clean and plenty of hot water.
The city was very busy and the price reflected this. It was very expensive for the standard. I would not recommend it

Staff = Great; Location = Good; Hotel = Adequate+

The Opal experience was positive due to the staff.  The hotel itself is like staying with an elderly aunt...bit of a time capsule experience.  If you stay there, and like Sushi, go to YamaSho on Post...absolutely fantastic.
Nice hotel, staff, nice breakfast. The room assigned to me is wonderful - near at elevator.
review.locationRemarks: shopping & restaurants neighbors.

review.title: An older hotel that tries to please.
review.reviewText: Arrived late on 4/17 and desk clerk worked like crazy to find us a room. They have a motel-like addition to the hotel (out back) that has seen better days. Clerk tried to find a suitable room for us, even offering to upgrade for free, but could find nothing but the dumpy room out back. Advised in morning ask for a new room to meet our needs. Clerk in morning says night clerk should have blocked out a nice room for us but did not, so we had to take a 2nd floor room. It was OK, but still not what I had hoped for. All staff were friendly and helpful. First night room had a defective telephone and no instructions on how to work the thermostat for heat. It was turned to off, so would not heat the room. Continental breakfast was so-so, just standard bagels, muffins, fruit, toast, juice, etc. Served 6:30 am to 10:00 am daily. All in all, it was a good experience. Have free coffee and tea in lobby all the time. Also a selection of newspapers available. Right next to TENDERLOIN district, so restricted as to where you might stroll. Mel's Drive-in is on the lower level with access from hotel. Across street id TOMMY'S JOYNT, kind of an eclectic spot. Both restaurants were reviewed on "Diners, Drive-in and Dives" on the Food Network. Location suited us as we were able to walk to our destination, the Northern California Cherry Blossom Festival in Japantown. Nice people, great parade and displays.
review.positiveRemarks: Desk staff. Proximity to Japantown. Restaurant is hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Better lighting in rooms. Bed update. I swear, first room had two 3/4 size beds I am 5'7" and my feet hung over the edge. Second room was not the same
review.locationRemarks: Tenderloin (bums, beggars, users)  all within a block away. Daytime felt safe in the area, but would not walk around anywhere at night.

review.title: Hotel Away from Main Street
review.reviewText: The hotel is away from the main street of Market, Bart and the Town Square so if you want to walk your looking at 4 to 5 blocks.  On the second day we found we were able to take the 47 bus towards Fishermans Warf which you can get off 1.5 blocks away which was great for $2.25.  The bus stop was very close to the hotel.  We also took a bus to Golden Gate bridge over to the park and then took a different bus back to the hotel.  The hotel did offer free internet and breakfast which was great.  The Bart is 5 blocks away but they did offer a shuttle for $16 each to airport (Bart is just under $10).  Depending what your plans are will depend if this is the hotel for you.  I found it too far from everything.
review.locationRemarks: Too far away from everything.

review.title: Totally recommend
review.reviewText:
Staff are nice very professional , they will save your bags last day after check out if u want to stay longer in city after your check out . 
Hotel not totally new but clean , bathroom are new and clean , I would use the same hotel for my next trip very reasonable for the price .

review.title: Handy for public transport.
review.reviewText: I have stopped at the Opal on many occasions. It is clean and staff are very helpful. I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: Four blocks from California cable car. Direct bus service to Fisherman's Wharf. Also direct bus service to AT & T Park (San Francisco Giants Baseball)

review.title: Good location for USquare/ Tenderloin area
review.reviewText: Rooms have newer outer and inner sash windows so you are able to reduce noise from outside. Breakfast is OK and Staff is very helpful.
Opal is an older, but clean hotel. Although relatively outdated, the low cost makes it an attractive option for those wishing to stay near downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is free, but consists of frozen waffles, toast, yogurt, and curiously small apples, and pears.
review.locationRemarks: 30min walk to pier 39, museums, and the waterfront.

review.reviewText: Very old hotel with thin walls. You can hear every noise from the next room.

review.title: Nice hotel  near Masonic
review.reviewText: We stayed here because we had a concert to attend at the Masonic which cancelled on our way there. We made the best of it and found we weren't to far from anything at this location . Great hotel for the price and sandwich shop across the street it outstanding

review.title: A convenient and family friendly place to stay
review.reviewText: Close to local bus stop and shopping area.  Hotel has its old charm but a bit dated, nonetheless it's family friendly place.

review.title: Hotel 15 min walk from Union Square
review.reviewText:
The hotel was fine. Room was big enough (2 double beds) with flat tv. The hotel look a bit old, probably from seventies. Bathroom was very small and a bit outdated. However, the room and specially the bathroom was always clean with new bath towels every day (something which is very important to me!). The room was a bit noisy because of the street traffic, probably just because the window was facing the street.
From the hotel¬¥s guests point of view, it was very quiet. There were families and couples, so no noisy students and/or party people.

Staff was polite. Breakfast was very simple and sometimes the breakfast room was crowded but you can however eat enough.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is 15 min walk from Union Square, the starting point of San Francisco sightseeing and cable car. Maybe it should be avoided to

review.title: Located fairly near where we needed to go.
review.reviewText: Where do I start? Hmmmm, first of all our room looked NOTHING at all like it did online. Very small, bad mattress's, smelled musty, we felt claustrophobic it was so small. Should have complained that very first day but we were soooooo tired we just wanted to go to bed. And by the way, the price was way too expensive for the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Liked the fact that when we did complain they upgraded our room to one much nicer on the third day. Management and employees were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the website to look like the rooms. On the website they look so much nicer than they are.
review.locationRemarks: Hard to answer that. It was fairly close to UCSF where I need to go for a Dr.appt.

review.title: Seen better days
review.reviewText:
Positives: Location , Try Tommy's bar across the street

Negatives: Old Hotel, had to change rooms at 1am due to plumbing noises, wifi was patchy at best, was told to call the Wifi company when I complained, isn't that the Hotel's job?

Ok if you get a good deal as I did but not worth the full price, I stay in SF monthly and this is average at best

review.title: The Opal
review.reviewText:
Surprisingly large room, good view of the city, everything was kept up nicely.
Could not connect to the WiFi at all... (first world problems).
I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: size of rooms, large bathrooms and closet space.
review.negativeRemarks: larger beds, fix wifi, better breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: bars, metro, food, clubs, etc.

review.title: Long Weekend in SF
review.reviewText:
As my friends and I are recent grads, this hotel was perfect for us.  It is located in close proximity to the BART/MUNI Civic Center Station, it is close to the center of the city, and it is fairly priced. 

The three of us stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We had no issues at all, minus the fact that a fire alarm went off in the middle of the night.  Breakfast was very simple; fruit, toast, bagels, cream cheese, butter, jam, yogurt.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is very friendly & the hotel is located centrally.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast could use improvement.

review.reviewText: Good service.  Like the lounge area and the wine and cheese evening.  Locations is not that great.

review.title: Cheap and comfortable - met our 3 star expectation
review.reviewText:
The hotel was a good deal as part of our flight/hotel/car combo deal, which allowed us to spend more on the things that counted for us, such as nice dinners and lunches, tours and so on. 

As a place to sleep, this hotel was adequate. Bed was comfy enough, room was clean and quiet enough. Our room faced Van Ness, so we heard some traffic noise but we could deal with it. We did find that house keeping didn't come some days. Ok for us but some may be annoyed by that.

The breakfasts (which were included in our stay) were mediocre. We opted to eat elsewhere instead. 

The free wifi was actually quite good and fast enough for streaming in our room. 

Parking seemed expensive (we had a rental car via our expedia package), would have rather had cheaper parking and give up the weak breakfast.

We didn't use the gym but took a look and it seemed decent, people were using it and it had new machines.

The whole hotel had a strange sour smell - it was everywhere, lobby, hallways, etc. It just smelled really old, like a mix of old paint, carpet, cleaners, etc. Thankfully our room didn't smell - but it took some getting used to every time we came back from a day out. This would be our only complaint.
review.positiveRemarks: It is connected to Mel's Diner, via a door in the lobby. This is where we went for breakfast. Healthy options.
review.negativeRemarks: Somehow air it out and get rid of that smell that permeates the whole place.
review.locationRemarks: We walked a lot as well as did day trips in our rental car. We found it was easy to get to places we wanted to go.

review.title: Really nice stay
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 5 nights for spring break with my boyfriend. We arrived earlier than we thought and were able to check in around noon on the first day with no additional cost (awesome customer service). Hotel breakfast was your usual toast, muffins, bagel, waffle, fruits, juice, and yogurt. We had it the first 2 days, but for the other days, we wanted to try brunch places in SF- totally recommend Buena Vista at Fisherman's Wharf and Brenda's 2 blocks away. Hotel location was superb- close to many bus stations, and check-out was hassle free. Overall we really really enjoyed our stay!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff friendliness, security (swipe key card to get in)
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was right next to the elevators so it was noisy at times- but it was bearable.

review.reviewText: There must be some sewer problem, there are always sewer smelling in the room when we are back from outside.  The smell is very strong in three of the five days we stay that bring the whole comfort level down.  Overall the staff is the best in terms of the service.  I would still recommend apart from the sewer smell ...
review.positiveRemarks: very unique, close to down town and public transportation is easy to access.
review.negativeRemarks: The sewer system!!
review.locationRemarks: A lot on Van Ness Road, Food and shops and Theatre and other community... and close to Union Square that most of the activities can be found

review.title: Good location, good hotel.
review.reviewText:
Good breakfast, over all worth for staying ...
An old/stylish fashion hotel with good facilities....
Staff seems a bit uncompetent and the area is kind of ghetto. The only good thing about this hotel is the free Continental breakfast.
Everyone was really nice and the room was never dirty.

review.title: Economic  hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: location is very good, it's easy to take public transportation here. The hotel is a little bit old, but the condition is acceptable

review.title: We didn't know the hotel was in the Tenderloin dis
review.reviewText: The Tenderloin district was lined with men sleeping on the streets. This was very sad. Where are the churches who preach "love thy neighbor?" The neighborhood hardly had any good restaurants. We went to an Afghanistan restaurant which wasn't bad. The food was a little bland, however. The owners probably dumbed it down for us Americans. Would I go there again? Probably. Staff great, very friendly as well as the guests. They had a great wine hour. Breakfasts were the usual: boiled eggs, muffins, yogurt, and oranges. Not great, but free. Future clientele would have to be able to overlook the bodies laying on the street. Since the churches can do it maybe others can as well.
review.positiveRemarks: stain glass windows, original I assume, old decor, and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, more variety. As is no change, day in day out.
review.locationRemarks: NOTHING without taking a bus.

review.title: Good Hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: We arrived at the Opal in the evening hours. The lady at the front desk was very pleasant, efficient, and helpful. The rooms are very small and dated, but clean. Breakfast had few choices, but was sufficient for the one night that we were there.
review.positiveRemarks: Historic appeal. Clean, VERY friendly  and efficient staff - from the front desk people to the maids and other service people. Pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms could use some updating.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is a great city! The Opal Hotel is located close to the California Line of the Cable Car system. Easy to hop on and go to the major attr

review.reviewText: Surprisingly really good, nice people, clean, convenient rooms
We got this hotel at the last minute and was very surprised. Had a nice stay and would stay there again.

review.title: Decent place downtown
review.reviewText: It's a decent hotel. It's a 15 minute walk from the Civic center train station. The room I got was good sized, clean, and older just like every other place in SF. The breakfast could be better, but if you can live with hard-boiled eggs, pastries, and toaster waffles every day it's not too bad.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size. Wifi that worked. Free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast buffet should include some meat and scrambled eggs.

review.title: Clean and Convenient
review.reviewText: The Opal is clean and comfortable.  The staff was helpful and friendly; however, not as knowledgeable about the area as I would like.  The continental breakfast was great.  Compete with bagels, waffles, muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit, juice, coffee and tea and all the toppings you need to satisfy your tastes, the dining hall was clean and the staff was very efficient and cordial.  Many thanks to them.  Our room, especially the bathroom was clean and well kept.  The best part is the convenient location to many popular sites.  It was fantastic for our main adventure to the War Memorial Opera House' we could walk to and from the hotel to the Opera House comfortably. The front door is always locked and only can be accessed by your room key.  At the end of our stay, we were able to print our plane tickets at the computer that is available for guests to use.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a safe, clean and convenient place to stay at a reasonable price.

review.title: Location and hotel staff
review.reviewText:
Pros: 
1. Good location - The location is a walking distance to union square, Japantown and restaurants. If you are into asian restaurants and like to walk, this hotel is for you; however, just a caution that you may see some homeless guys along the way. No big deal for us because they are not a bothersome at all. 
2. Friendly staff - Most of the hotel staff are so accomodating and friendly specially 'Justin' (front desk). She makes our stay interesting. 
Cons:
1. No microwave  and refrigerator even on thier suite room.
2. Some beds made a squeaky sounds.
review.negativeRemarks:
1. Having a microwave, coffee maker and a refrigerator is a plus.
2. Replace  new beds.

review.reviewText: It was a great experience.  Good price and clean. Could walk everywhere and the staff was friendly.

review.title: Nice reasonably priced hotel in SF Civic Center
review.reviewText: Check in and out were quick. Room was nicely furnished and in good condition though lacking amenities. There was an iron and board but no water boiler for coffee, etc, microwave, or refrigerator. Internet was usually very slow if usable at all. Hotel computer is 25 cents per minute, slow, and didn't work until service provider was called to fix it. It charged me $5 minimum for trying when it wouldn't work but this was refunded after I contacted the service provider. Front desk was very helpful with computer problems. Buffet breakfast is good though there is no cereal of any kind. Parking is quite a bit less at the neighboring AMC garage which the front desk suggested as an alternative.
review.positiveRemarks: Nicely furnished and clean room, helpful front desk, good buffet breakfast, coffee always available in lobby. Two-mile walk to water is reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless internet and hotel computers, especially charging for hotel computers. Add cereal to buffet; oatmeal would be nice, water boiler in room.
review.locationRemarks: Two miles to wharf. Plenty of interesting restaurants, bars, shops along Polk St. Library not too far. Fed Ex not far. Mel's Diner right next door.

review.title: Great Hotel, centrally located.
review.reviewText:
We really liked this hotel, and would stay here again.
We loved the "old" ambience of the hotel....especially the stained glass windows and reception area.
The staff were all wonderful and helpful.
The complimentary breakfast had a great selection of food items.We did miss the cereal and milk.
Loved our room with a view.
Also enjoyed the stairs (very homely) like we were in a home not a hotel.
Easy access to Mel's diner.
Easy access to bus service.
Wifi worked well
We did find that some of the electrical plugs were loose. (on the desk lamp) as well as the one behind the TV.
We really loved our stay here...very unique environment./ character...a nice change from the modern,generic hotels we have stayed in in the past.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Really nice hotel in a convenient location.
review.reviewText: It was much nicer than I expected. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay and I would recommend to anyone staying in San Francisco.

review.title: Felt like home
review.reviewText: I felt very safe and comfortable there. It has a wonderful location because you can walk or take the bus anywhere in the Bay area.
review.locationRemarks: There is a wonderful pizza place called Village Pizza that we went to a few times for dinner. Sandwiches to pizza and the staff is very kind.

review.title: Excellent value hotel near Civic Center
review.reviewText: I was fooled by the exterior of the hotel into thinking it was going to be below average but once i got inside, i realized it is a very well cared for hotel with excellent facilities for a city center hotel. The fitness center is setup very well for cycling focused aerobics and runners. The breakfast is basic fare for a continental style but if offered lots of fresh whole fruit like oranges, pears, apples and bananas. I have stayed in the high end hotels in town and while they have more elaborate fixtures etc. unless you are spending your entire day there, they are not three times the value.
review.positiveRemarks: Fitness center stationary bikes and location near civic center
review.locationRemarks: Civic Center

review.reviewText:
I BOOKED THIS FOR FIVE GUESTS
THEY DONT EVEN PROVIDE FIFTH BED TO MY GUEST
It was a great stay and the breakfast was fabulous!! And the restaurant connected to the hotel was great!!

review.title: Decent location
review.reviewText: The lobby is tired, and the initial impression was that this was very low budget.  However, I found the rooms to be clean and nicely redone.  Overall, the stay was terrific, and the price was a bargain.  I would stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: The entrance and the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Union square.

review.title: Nice hotel only 5 blocks from union square
review.reviewText: Overall nice hotel. Most places within walking distance. Anything close to the downtown area your going to pay higher . For the money it was worth it . Cleanliness is a big thing and it was always well kept. Took my bf for valentines day for his first time so I wanted to have him enjoy himself . The room is perfect size one ca king bed , tv , desk, bathroom ,walk in closet. Also complimentary breakfast , coffee, teas, and juice. I would stay there again. Had a great time.

review.title: Old 50s hotel, that puts you back in that era
review.reviewText: Staff welcomed you in friendly manner, but where not so good in solving problems when it came to our personal belongings being locked up in a storage area and no one seemed to have a key. I mailed the hotel to try and retrieve the items, but no response was given. They could improve their customer service
review.negativeRemarks: Keeping a key in the hotel for items in storage in the evening. We lost all our items, as management did not have a key to the locked area.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the red bus, pick up areas. A little out of town, but good value for money

review.title: Nice Room, but no Internet
review.reviewText: Like the room... large and comfortable.  But, 1. No Internet for either my iphone nor MacBook, so I can't stay there since I need at least 1 internet connection.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was large and well apointed
review.negativeRemarks: Need to get their internet working
review.locationRemarks: Great location for the federal courts in downtown SF

review.title: if you dont mind the neighbourhood, AWESOME hotel
review.reviewText:
Good location, close to transit and touristy destinations.
Anything in the tenderloin area will be older... I usually stay in this area for the convenience.
If you are looking for a botique hotel away from panhandlers, etc better off staying in the fishermans wharf area. If you are used to staying in urban centres and dont mind the common urban 'issues' than the opal is a great choice. Very clean, great breakfast, extremely helpful and kind staff. One night they had complimentary wine and cheese. I always saw the staff vacuuming the halls and the cleaning personal every morning looking like they were doing a thorough job. We stayed on the top floor and I found the hotel to be very quiet. Unless there was sirens I didnt hear the road noise and rarely heard other guests. The restaurant located beside it is great too, but there is lots of choices around.
review.positiveRemarks: location to transit. staff. amenities. wifi.

review.title: Good location & good price
review.reviewText:
Dear the Manager of The Opal Hotel,

My name is Hai Tran, I was the guest at your hotel from 1st Feb to 3rd Feb2015, I stayed at room 426. I was so happy with your staff & their hospitality & helpful during the time I stayed at your hotel. It was a small problem at the first room & I told the receptionist & he called the technican to fix it for us however the problem could not be fixed at once therefore we were informed to move to other room. We were happy in all.
I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Nice looking and very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay. Staff was friendly and rooms were comfortable.

review.title: Classic old hotel
review.reviewText: Overall the stay here was pleasant and the staff did their best to make us feel comfortable.

review.title: Great rate and convenient location!
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were exceptionally friendly, courteous, and welcoming. The room was comfortable and clean. The mini bath products smell good! The front door to the hotel is accessed only by room key or buzzing the front desk so it felt safe. My only complaint was the beds could use an update- I could feel the springs. :/

review.title: affordable.....
review.reviewText: We had a double bed room.... A bit tight. Shower tight. Bed comfy. Brought my own pillow (due to other posts about flat pillows) no air flow and a bit stuffy. no fan in bath room. Staff very friendly. Breakfast exactly what expected. Corner bar across the street.... Cheap drinks-good food and friendly staff.

review.title: Nice hotel with good accessibility
review.reviewText: Our stay at this historic place The Opal was memorable. We appreciated the quaint d√©cor and architecture of The Opal, but even more the hospitality of the friendly staff. The hotel is a little further from the usually hustling bustling area of the Fisherman's Wharf, however, it is also in a prime location of the city. As soon as you step out of the hotel, you will have great access to one of the many MUNI public transit buses that will take you to the wharf or other locations in downtown. Hence, it does not seem that one is too far away from most of the tourist spots. Besides, there is a lot of choice in terms of eating around The Opal and if you still want something specific you can always hop in to a MUNI and get to most neighborhoods in no time.

review.title: Great price for this hotel!
review.reviewText: Had to park off site and pay extra,but the location is great, the staff is great the price is great!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was a little hard for our taste but room was clean and nice
review.negativeRemarks: new mattress
review.locationRemarks: Theater, ballet resturaunts

review.title: See my arrival review
review.reviewText: Stained carpet, book only if you plan on only sleeping here. It worked for that. Caution walking in area at night.

review.title: Surprisingly very clean!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here due to the location and price. Surprisingly this hotel and our room was clean! We even pulled the sheets off the bed to check the mattress and examined it for any signs of stains or bugs. The bathroom was small but had a nice shower. We requested a room with a tub like many of the reviews of this hotel suggest to. We were also near the elevator which i thought would be noisy but we didn't hear anything nor did we hear the traffic on the busy street of Van Ness. There is a bus station right outside of the hotel and if you want to get to the Pier's you can take bus 47 which runs every 15 minutes. The hotel offers a very light breakfast.  Fruit, yogurts,  bagels, cereals,  bread for toasting, and instant oatmeal. They offer hot water, tea, and coffee all day long. Also a Mel's diner that is 24 hours is connected to the hotel. There are homeless people around this hotel but honestly there are homeless people around every corner there. They didn't bother us and we never felt unsafe. We ended our last night watching a movie at the AMC movie theater that is just next block over. We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: walking distance to Mascone Center, resturants
review.reviewText: check in was pleasant, room was good for the price, older property with character
review.negativeRemarks: update rooms, stay with theme
review.locationRemarks: Mascone Center, Japan Town

review.title: easy public transit close by
review.reviewText: we did a 3 day weekend in the city and stayed at the Opal. It was comfortable with a clean room, good breakfast to start the morning with, minutes from the union square area, easy access to several bus lines and a helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: location, decent breakfast to get the day going, close to the bus lines
review.locationRemarks: movies and restaurants nearby.

review.title: Opal Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with rooms on the smaller size, but perfect if you just need a play to stay like me and my friends. Close to many areas and good pricing.

review.title: Not for walking around
review.reviewText:
Room was old and small, no dressers for our clothes. 6 block walk to √ß√†ble car line. Even at noon it felt  unsafe due to great numbers of homeless roaming the
Streets and doorways.
Do try Tommy's joint across the street for great brisket sandwiches at low
Prices

review.title: A good place to put your head down.
review.reviewText: I normally stay at 4 star hotels but this time I wanted to save money and be close to my venue. We needed the room just for a few hours to sleep and this hotel was perfect for it. We needed a place to sleep and park the car.

review.title: "only if you are really desperate"
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and not well updated. They need  to invest in new pillows and new beds. The rooms are small and a bit depressing. The area of SFO is not too good. There is no doorman so they keep the door locked at all times. You have to use your room key to open the exterior door. The staff was pleasant and helpful but the breakfast that is included with the room rate is minimal.
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: Motel is more like it
review.reviewText: If they could have charged us for breathing they would have. Horrible ·∫Éi fi, no cable, extra bed advertised at ten dollars then twenty when we got there and was already supposed to have been in the room when we got there.  Hotel staffwas unfriendly and aloof. You'd probably find a nicer room at best western.

review.title: Opal.
review.reviewText: Very nice old hotel.  Walkable to many attractions.  Dodgy neighborhood adjacent- Tenderloin.  Flat pillows.  Mediocre breakfast.  Otherwise very good.

review.title: Nice hotel but the area can be a concern
review.reviewText: Overall, I was completely satisfied with the facilities provided in this hotel. Although I paid a similar amount at one of the hotels in LA before coming to San francisco, I found the opal to be much better in all respects. The suite was sweet with a very spacious bathroom and big beds. Sergio, the man at the reception is a very helpful person. However, the neighborhood is something to be worried about if you like exploring the streets at night.

review.title: Nice place!
review.reviewText: The location is great the staff was very nice and courteous our room was clean and cozy I would definitely recommend the Opal Hotel for a nice weekend in San Fransisco!

review.title: Good Value for the Money
review.reviewText: I found the room to be musty and the carpet felt damp.  When we were there in December 2014 there was a rain/wind storm on Dec 10/11 causing the power to go out. Breakfast is included which is awesome! There is a fitness room - you can lift weights or do steps. The room was immaculate, and beds were super comfortable and warm. The thermostat; however, was a bit difficult to control, and the room was a bit hot for our taste although the staff was very nice and quickly came up to work on the thermostat. The staff, in general, was fantastic, very helpful, printed out our boarding passes, gave us info about the city and tours, and arranged our airport shuttle.

review.title: Affordable hotel close to the Union station
review.reviewText:
Opal is a nice hotel, a little old, but clean and comfortable. We were three friend and got a double bed room, which makes it very affordable.
It is very close to the Union station and the heart of the shopping center and restaurants of the city. You can take the cable car from the Union Station to the Fisherman wharf, or take the cable car near the hotel to the China town. All very close!
The staff were helpful and cooperative. Our drain was clogged and they fixed it immediately. 
Coffee and tea is served all day in the lobby.
Downsides:
The main downside is the WiFi. The wifi in the room is free, but VERY VERY weak, I could barely browse any website. The worst thing was that I didn't even had reception to use my data in the room. The lobby was fine, but no data reception in the room (my career is Verison, famous for good reception!).
The rooms do not have a fridge. The carpeting is a little old and makes the room smells old!
I had read in the reviews that the pillows are awful, and it was true! Very uncomfortable pillows!!
review.positiveRemarks:
Its location, it is in walking distance to the Union Station.
It is clean.
It is affordable.
review.negativeRemarks:
The free Wifi is very weak, almost zero reception in the rooms.
No fridge in the room.
The pillows are very uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks:
The Union Station is in walking distance; a good place for the night life and also shopping
Take the cable car to the Fisherman wharf and China town

We had a recently renovated double delux room on the top floor which was good. The continental breakfast which was included was very good, heaps of food. The staff  are friendly and very efficient, in particular Candace and Jennie. There was a cheese and wine evening in the lobby on the Wednesday night which was a lot of fun ( thank you Jennie ). The hotel is in a good location. The number 47 bus stops outside to go to Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square is about a 10 to 15 minute walk. I would definitely stay at the Opal again.

review.title: Budget Hotel, easy transportation.
review.reviewText:
Staying this budget hotel for a week in mid Nov 2014 was a nice experience. I booked a week earlier, a deluxe kind size room for about hundred and twenty per day. Some of the previous reviewers mentioned about problems such as small rooms, noisy area, very cautious Tenderloin roadside people etc. It was useful for us to be more proactive when we visited SF.

1. Rooms are quiet small, the bath tub is very smaller one. 
2. The complementary buffet breakfast has simple menu. I suggest you to use a cup of hot water to put the eggs in it before eating to keep the egg warm. We were from hot country and eating cold food in cold climate was nightmare for us. So we made use of simple breakfast. I really appreciate the maid to take care of the breakfast section, they are kind and served us well. Do not expect different menus. Each day, same menu. Nearby there is Mel's diner, which we haven't tried due to western.
3. Front desk people are good, and they served well.
4. During each day room cleaning service, the lady opens the window glass doors. So some of the previous reviewers might have forgot to close the doors so that they might have felt more noisy. For the first day, we were also felt in the same way, very noisy, not able to sleep. So close the both bathroom and bedroom window glass doors properly and you will never here a sound from outside.

review.reviewText:

However, San Francisco is fairly walkable, so not much of an issue. Lots of bars and restaurants on Polk St, and there is a Mel's Drive-In attached to the hotel or Tommy's Joynt across the street for sandwiches.

We parked at the AMC Theater parking garage right next door for $26/night rather than the $42/night for the hotel garage.

The breakfast was typical of included meals. Coffee, juice, pastries, bagels and bread, cereal and fruit. Nothing to write home about, but a nice quick meal.

review.reviewText: I've stayed in a much sketchier, albeit cheaper, hotel in SF.  This one is still "affordable" by SF standards but was a lot more comfortable and safer.  I'll likely try to stay here again since it hits that sweet spot, while also being reasonably close to transportation (multiple nearby bus stops, plus BART/Muni Civic Center station is about a 15 minute walk, albeit through a slightly sketchy area).  Staff was nice, though sometimes a little disorganized (my room wasn't available, so they gave me another one, but that one ended up being occupied, and they didn't make any offer to comp me anything for requiring me to move rooms mid-stay).  Can't really say anything bad about the hotel, will definitely stay again.

review.title: Inexpensive hotel in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Opel during our visit to San Francisco. If you're looking for fancy, this hotel isn't for you; but if you're looking for an inexpensive, clean, quaint/historic, friendly place that is within relatively easy walking distance of everything San Francisco has to offer, this hotel can't be beat! Yes, it is on the outskirts of the Tenderloin District, and walking through that district is an interesting experience...but we never felt unsafe among the neighborhood's denizens - just use the same precautions at night that you'd use in any big city. 
The staff was PHENOMENAL, willing to go out of the way to help their guests. After we checked in, I read a few OLD reviews that mentioned problems with bed bugs, which made me unnecessarily paranoid, but I can assure you we had no such problems! The location was great - we pretty much walked everywhere - from Haight / Ashbury to Fisherman's Wharf to Union Square - all are within 30 minutes or less.

review.reviewText: After reading prior reviews,  I wasn't sure what to expect when we booked The Opal for our stay in San Francisco. When my family and I checked in, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was bigger than I expected and was roomy enough for the 5 of us. The 2 queen beds were comfortable and the pull out sofa bed was okay. The bathroom was small but the size of the room made up for it. The hotel is old but kept nice and clean. We didn't have to worry about parking for our rent a car since the hotel has a parking lot for a daily fee. A convenient feature about this hotel is the diner that is connected to the hotel lobby. When we arrived to check into the hotel close to midnight, hungry and tired, we were glad to see the entrance to Mel's Diner. Open 24 hours, The diner has great food and reasonable prices. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at The Opal and would not hesitate to stay again.

We normally stay only at big flagged hotels such as Holiday Inn & Marriott's but thought it might be nice to stretch our comfort zone and try a local boutique. We were glad we did! The kids even said they felt it was one of the better hotels we've stayed in. The location made it easy to traverse to all the tourist spots we had on our agenda and the staff were very helpful. The breakfast room did leave a bit for wanting, It's a small room for the amount of guest the hotel supports and was crowded pretty much all the time. We tried breakfast at different hours each day trying to find a less crowded dinning time and were not successful. However there are many coffee shops in the area in walking distance. Though we didn't have any problems checking in the family before us did and the hotel staff quickly found a solution for their stay in a calm and controlled manor.  The bathroom of our room was a bit lacking in counter space but we all came prepared with our travel bags and made it work, just like in the dorms or the gym. Over all I went in with a low expectation and left impressed. It's a good value for the money.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is just ok. Nothing special about it. It's an older hotel that was renovated. The rooms are very small with a small bathroom.  The location is in a busy area of the city and parking is tough to find.  They do have a parking area behind the hotel that is convenient to park in, but charge $42 a day for it.  All in all not the worst place I ever stayed in, but I won't go back there.  We were there for business so not a big deal.  Other decent hotels in the area were going for $300-$400 a night.  Including taxes, I paid $250 a night, so I decided to go cheaper and got what I paid for.  The positives were the free continental breakfast, free wifi, and the wine and cheese tasting they had on Wednesday.  The hotel was also very close to many good restaurants. It was a 6 minute drive to Union Square, and only about 15 minutes away from Fisherman's Wharf.  It's also very close to downtown San Francisco and getting on the freeway was easy to do.  It's not really walking distance to anywhere worth going to around the hotel.  I was told that the restaurant across the street was really good, known for their hof brau.  I never got the chance to go there so can't say much about it.

review.title: Great for the cost but beware of..
review.reviewText:
Overall, my boyfriend & I had a fine stay and would recommend The Opal to friends. 

The Cons: 
- During our stay there were construction noises early in the morning (the price may have been adjusted lower than usual to compensate for that..)
- The toilet is 5ft from the bed. The bathroom door is parallel to the bed 3 ft away & opens to face the toilet. I prefer a bit more acoustical insulation & privacy when having a romantic trip..
- Paid a deposit to the hotel (half the overall commute cost) to have a van service deliver us to the airport. The van was very late and we were then told it was a non-refundable deposit & a separate company from the hotel so they held no responsibility. Shady. 
- Food was no satisfactory but we eat very healthy. The fruit tasted like there was sugar all over it. The yogurt had a lot of unnecessary ingredients, (I'm gluten free so did not eat the bagels, toast, muffins).

The Pros: 
- Great location for those that like to walk. Central to Golden Gate Park, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, etc. Also on a main road so it's easy to take a bus to the door of The Opal. 
- The room was very spacious and clean. There was a tv and heating/cooling system we could control. Another handy amenity was the iphone dock/radio. 
- Free wifi throughout the building. 
- Free guide maps and ideas of things to do. 
- Nice & comfy lobby. 

Acceptable for the price and grand scheme.

Fitness room is very small but had the essentials for a decent work-out, howerver avoid going when there might be more then 2 people in there. Breakfast room is too small for the number of guests in the hotel so if you don't get there between 6.30am-7am you won't get a table. There's a good restaurant adjacent to the hotel, highly recommend it. Getting to the Financial District in the morning by taxi costs about $14 + tip and takes 10mins, walking takes about 30mins. Near the hotel: WholeFoods Market on California st, CVS pharmacy just 2 blocks away, Sushi bar, Lebanese Tapas bar, Burger King, McDonalds, Starbucks.

review.title: Great place to stay for first timers in SFO
review.reviewText:
I have visited the US for a 2-week vacation and one of my itineraries was to go to San Francisco one weekend. I didn't know that it was the weekend of "Bay to Breakers" which really a big event in SFO. Even though it was a big event, the price was still reasonable at this hotel.

I have read several reviews were they mentioned that they did not like the neighborhood, but I have to disagree. It was in a very strategic location. The hotel is on along one of the main streets - Van Ness Avenue. AMC Theatre is beside the hotel, so you can watch a movie when you're free. There's a diner at the ground floor. Walgreens is a few blocks away. SFO City Hall is also a couple of blocks down the street of Van Ness Avenue. So, I think, if you are particular with the location, this is really good.

As for the room, we were given a big room with a king size bed. We have requested if it is possible to add another bed because one of my relatives would crash there for a night, but the reception mentioned that due to state regulation, we could not add more beds due to the space requirements. Didn't argue anymore, but just figured out a way to so that my relative could sleep over. Bathroom is really big. Internet is free. Mattress and pillows are comfortable. Do not expect a good view though (mine was a view of the side street, which is not a deal breaker). They do have continental breakfast for free as well.
