They didn't have any clickers left so we had to be buzzed into the parking lot and got attitude about it. The room itself was decent and clean.

review.title: Nice SMALL Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice and welcoming. I paid for 2 Deluxe room, but found them to be 2 very small rooms. If I were rooming alone it would have been fine, but since there were 2 of us it seemed a little crowded. It is a nice older hotel in a great location close to USF and some really good restaurants. Overall it was more convenient than anything else. They do offer a gym, laundry room, free wifi, and a decent breakfast. The parking garage is also on the smaller side, but it is San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice staff and a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: maybe offer eggs for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: near USF and great restaurants.

review.reviewText:
The best thing about The Opal is location. We were minutes away from all the tourist "must sees".
San Francisco has an outstanding MUNI system including the cable cars, we were able to get everywhere with little wait. We rented a car because we drove up from LAX, but if you fly into SF, you won't need a rental car thus avoiding the $34 parking fee.

review.title: Used this hotel for a week stay in SF
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel is very convenient, at walking distance from Civic Center, and if you like walking a little more, to Union Square. Just have to take the bus at the hotel's corner to get to Fishermen's Warf.

Rooms are comfortable and clean, the only drawbacks were that the breakfast room is usually full and is difficult to find an empty table, and the carpets have that smell that reminds you the place is not new.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and clean room, convenient location. Not noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: More room at the breakfast place.
review.locationRemarks: Get a bus on the corner to Fishermen's Wharf, Pier 39 or Union Square. You can walk to Civic Center, Union Sq. and Chinatown.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: good to stay for a few days, easy to reach by public transportation, free wireless, good price, breakfast included, nice personnel.
review.negativeRemarks: ok for price
review.locationRemarks: near to everything in the city

review.title: Happy with my stay :)
review.reviewText: Nice and quiet, within walking distance to the Fillmore. :)

review.title: Really bad showers at the Opal!
review.reviewText: I read the reviews before booking, so I knew what I'd be getting myself into. I chose the Opal for it's location, proximity to transportation and the price tag. Overall, I felt safe at the Opal, although there are a lot of people wandering around that neighbourhood at night. I am docking points for a very hard mattress, flat pillows, curtains that wouldn't close all the way for privacy, and a terrible shower! Firstly, the shower head looked like it was going to pop out of the wall at any moment, and the water pressure was nil. In addition, the "Hot" water ( which was closer to warm) came in an out, alternating with cold water. Anything but nice! To it's credit the Opal has some great Art Deco style, and the Diner next door was really convenient. I won't stay there again though.

review.title: Not the best part of town.
review.reviewText: Good enough. Best part was the front desk woman who took care of us. Price is good, of course.

review.title: opal hotel san francisco
review.reviewText:
location was good - nice and central with lots of bars and restaurants nearby

My shower was appalling - barely getting warm enough and the bath tub would not drain properly so you ended up showering in luke warm water whilst standing in a puddle of freezing cold water - not sure if that was the entire hotel or just my room but that definitely let me down as far as having a good experience at this hotel
review.negativeRemarks: the shower was terrible barely getting warm enough - the bathtub didn't drain properly so you ended up showering in luke warm water
review.locationRemarks: location was perfect

review.title: $149 is too much for this hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very old and the carpets and wall paper need to be replaced. The smell on the floors were terrible. The bathrooms was clean though. That is it. $149 per night is way too much for this hotel. And free breakfast is juice, water and a muffin or toast.

review.title: Bad condition
review.reviewText: The room I had so annoy early im the morning and very bad smell

review.title: Nice & affordable
review.reviewText: The staff was great, helpful, and the room was very clean. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It is a great hotel to stay in near downtown. Good location to public transportation and breakfast. Even partially renovated in the hotel, it needs some repair.

review.title: Hotel is good but not the neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is good but the neighborhood is not very safe. I wouldn't recommend it if you want to walk down to downtown SF. Bus stops are located very close to the hotel. Hotel staff are friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: there is a straight bus to pier 39 from the bus stop very close to the hotel. There is an awesome south Indian restaurant in the locality

review.title: Terrible, terrible location
review.reviewText: Surrounded by unsavoury characters. did not feel safe outside the hotel!!
review.negativeRemarks: It was fine for the price
review.locationRemarks: Horrible location. did not feel safe

review.title: Overall good hotel.
review.reviewText: good staff, good customer service. Hotel needs to be remodeled. The stairs were squeaking. The walls were thin, can hear people talking on the other rooms.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
It has good location, good working staff.
The restroom ventilator is too noisy.

review.title: Good deal for a nice stay
review.reviewText: We spent a wonderful week in San Francisco. The hotel was quiet and comfortable. The staff was smiling and always ready to help. Location was good. We had easy access to public transportation. It was convenient to have breakfast included.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was helpful. Room was comfortable. Reasonable price for was we got.
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of food proposed for the breakfast, more especially coffee. Smell of humidity in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good. At walking distance from main attraction, yet just far enough from the busy touristic streets. Cable car, bus and Muni access near.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Great small hotel for the price and great location. Room was small, but clean and comfortable. Parking was easy, and not overpriced.

review.title: Great value downtown
review.reviewText:
Comfortable lobby with sofas and chairs. Stylish, Retro feel. Room clean and comfortable for sleeping. Desk staff very courteous and helpful with directions across the bay when checking out.
Great place for the price.

review.title: SF trip
review.reviewText: Good hotel in SF. Good location. Would stay here again, but I would ask for a room in the main building. The back building is bit noise b/c is next to a street where you would hear people cleaning or dumping trash starting like 5 a.m. Parking is very expensive, $35 a night. Overall, it was a good experience.

review.title: Nice but very small
review.reviewText: Very small bathroom, pedestal sink, had to use the top of the toilet as a shelf. The front desk and housekeeping staff were great, which made up for the room.

review.title: Close to the concert
review.reviewText: A charming hotel close to the event we attended. Friendly staff made the experience even better. Not a traditional hotel, this one had the feeling of more of a Bed and Breakfast Inn.

review.title: Nice hotel located in a decent area
review.reviewText: Lots of access to the city from here. The price is right and the neighborhood is fine...if you're expecting a city without bums, try a different city!

review.title: Nice hotel. Near of all turistic places.
review.reviewText: Very recomendable place for stay. Jeanny is the best member of the hotel staff. Thanks.

review.title: Lots of Character
review.reviewText: The room was very clean. The staff was excellent. The bathroom was small, but served it's purpose. The room itself looked like a standard hotel room, but the bathroom had a lot of character that matched the feel of the lobby and outside of building. We had a view of the alley, but that is the essence of the location. We didn't stay in the hotel much anyway. There is too much to see. There is a nice diner attached to the hotel that had wonderful deserts. I highly recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Cereal and milk would have been nice to have for my kids. Or a small refrigerator in the room to put left-overs in or milk for the kids.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. We were only a few blocks from the cable car stop and there was a bus stop right outside the hotel lobby.

review.title: Good value for families
review.reviewText: We arrived well before the 3 pm check-in and were able to get into our rooms. Front desk staff was very helpful with restaurant and transportation information.
review.positiveRemarks: Great value. Close to bus and cable car stops.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast choices could be expanded. My kids were hoping for waffles : )
review.locationRemarks: Brenda's Restaurant for brunch!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Great experience. This hotel was in a convenient location as it was by The Fillmore auditorium and Union Square where we spent most of our time. The hotel staff was very helpful in helping us find our way around town and making sure we got the full San Francisco experience.

review.title: Old style inexpensive San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Old style inexpensive San Francisco hotel with friendly staff, only down fall which is typical of all of San Francisco the parking is very expensive but not nearly what it would cost you some other places in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, location, price and cleanliness!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the city

review.title: 3 day stopover.
review.reviewText: Great service, staff and location. Breakfast not so good, at the weekend there was no where to sit.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel at a bargain rate of $118 for one night with a king bed. It did have parking but you had to pay extra ($27) and it was in a very narrow parking garage under the building. By the time taxes and local assessments were added the total bill came to $171. Not exactly the savings I was hoping for, but that's San Francisco. The room was very small and felt old. The carpet had stains on it which made me want to keep my socks on at all times. The "breakfast" was basically yogurt cups and bagels or toast with juice or coffee. Again, you get what you pay for here.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs updating badly, especially the carpets. Even the hallways were stained.

review.title: Very central
review.reviewText: Easy to get around was very close to everything I needed to get done in San Francisco

review.title: Good Enough
review.reviewText: It was close enough to restaurants, walking distance. It is an old hotel and the room where we were assigned was clean enough but not enough ventilation.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell was terrible. Since the hotel is old, the carpet has a certain smell. Ventilation is not working.
review.locationRemarks: The location is close to a lot restaurants, banks, coffee house and cinema.

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff at this hotel location OK not too far to walk to Union Square overall it's value for money nothing fancy beds clean and comfortable

review.title: Nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: Had very nice experience. Was very clean. Front desc helpful and friendly. Additional plus, close to downtown and public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Everywhere was very clean, but they should renovate the hotel, like breakfast area need to be updated plus beds that were not quite comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, Chinatown and a short distance to public transportation

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: The Hotel is close to many good locations. Close to downtown, close to Japan Town, easy access to the bus. The restroom door didn't lock, we leave there a bag with garbage and the cleaning lady didn't notice it, cause it remained there. Also we can notice that they didn't vacuum the carpet of our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaniness

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean. Close to everything. Employees are very friendly and helpful. I would definitely return.

review.title: Nice hotel, in a relatively good area.
review.reviewText: Needed a hotel for the night. Didn't know what to expect even from the pictures but this hotel was perfect. The room wasn't anything fancy but it was extremely clean, bathroom looked nice, and the bed was comfortable. Only downside is parking. Just parked in the 24 Hour Fitness lot a block away cause it was cheaper and we didn't need overnight access to the car.

review.title: Great value for San Francisco downtown
review.reviewText: A well maintained (but older and smaller rooms) that was convenient to public transportation. Very helpful staff and a super value for San Francisco.

review.title: Bath room and hot water
review.reviewText: When your next-door tenant whose to take a shower he can hear the shower going to between the walls

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is great in a good location but be mindful of the area behind it. Was always someone put by the doors begging for money. Tommy's across the street has awesome food

review.title: Great price for a comfortable stay in the city.
review.reviewText: Although the room was small, it was quite comfortable. It was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The price was great and it was nice to be able to park your car and not have to valet park it.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is quite charming and the location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have liked to see cold and/or hot cereal offered for breakfast.

review.title: Great location for the money
review.reviewText: Great location for the money if you want to be downtown and close to Union square! The staff was amazing!!! Couldn't have asked for more in that department! They gave us tape to tape up our boxes better and there is a shuffle that they can call for you to go to the airport. It was $16 a person and actually got to the hotel early! The $16 a person is cheaper than what you can get a cab ride to the airport. The shuttle also takes you directly to the airline that you fly out of. The only drawback was the smell in the room but it was built in 1908. Also, I wished there were mods options for breakfast but overall I would stay there again!

review.title: Hotel Security
review.reviewText: We had a great time staying at the Opal, it seemed to be in the middle of everything and we were able to take the buses anywhere we wanted go. The room we originally checked into was super small but the staff was extremely friendly and moved us to a bigger one right away. The only downside to the hotel is that it is close to the Tenderloin district and there are quite a few peddlers outside. They didn't bother us too much, but security outside the doors could greatly reduce the beggers.

review.title: Good option when out of options
review.reviewText: The rooms are fairly old but they're still fully functional. There was a little bit of a smell but nothing pungent and it was well cleaned every day. The bathroom only had a bar of soap and and some shampoo, but the shower was nice and everything was clean. I slept well every night; good bed and little noise. I might go there again if I'm out of better options.

review.title: Decent hotel away from Union Square
review.reviewText:
This is a decent hotel in a section of town that is undergoing some renovation. A large building nearby is being torn down to build a new Kaiser hospital. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating, and the breakfast had excellent fresh fruit. The room itself was small but adequate and clean. Perhaps the worst thing was a mysterious smell akin to skunk that suddenly appeared in the room near midnight. It was gone by morning and did not reappear the next night.

The hotel is within walking distance of the California Street cable car, the Tenderloin and the Theater district, but not much else. The good part of being away from Union Square was the presence of fewer homeless people.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful and friendly. It was nice that the garage was secure and essentially hidden from the public, but seemed high at $35/day.
review.locationRemarks: The location was okay for us, but not exactly in the middle of things.

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: Great location--very centrally located. Good continental breakfast, free wine/cheese Wednesday, helpful staff, felt safe and well cared for. The room was clean and quiet. Super easy to catch any bus from within a block. We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Exceeded expectations
review.reviewText: Great location--very centrally located. Good continental breakfast, free wine/cheese Wednesday, helpful staff, felt safe and well cared for. The room was clean and quiet. Super easy to catch any bus from within a block. We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great deal for the location.
review.reviewText: Booked last minute and was very happy with price, hotel condition, and especially location.

review.title: Great little hotel off of Van Ness.
review.reviewText: No frills, just a nice place to stay if you're in the area and don't want to drop a ton of money.

review.title: Old, clean and downtown
review.reviewText: We came in with a smile and we quite with the same smile. Peoples where helpfull and gave us discount on diff√©rent activities purchasing like Bus Tour and Airport shuttle. It is always surpriising to see the room, it is so small, when they rent a Luxury room we look around and don't see anything who can be qualified of luxurious. It is clean but the bed was limited on confort and size, it was to soft. We where on the Greary street side, Noisy but we are downtown, we accepted that. When we rent a room for $150 per night in downtown San Francisco we must understand that is not Hilton or Sheraton or Radisson. We are happy because the place was clean, personnal nice, breakfast included correct, and direct access to Mel's snack bar restaurant where the chicken noodle soup is the best in America including Montr√©al.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is old and they do with what they have. Better bed would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk anywhere in town at 1 hour of walking who is not much in San Francisco or take the bus in the front the hotel Senior (62) do not pay.

review.title: Best deal going in SF, CA!!
review.reviewText: It started and ended with friendly and helpful hotel staff! Bradley and Anna made sure we had what we needed. The hotel has history, and it is clean and beautifully kept. Four blocks from the cable car and the 47 bus to Fishermen's Wharf is right outside! Civic Center just blocks away! Ill be back!!

review.title: The Opal - San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice enough, though the room was a little on the small side for 4 people.

I understand parking is scarce, but $60 for 2 nights was crazy - though it was safe and secure.

San Francisco was awesome though and the Public Transportation System was also nice enough.
review.positiveRemarks: The Lobby was nice, the rooms were fine, and the location was GREAT!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast of bagels and toast barely met the definition of 'Continental'.
review.locationRemarks: It is located on a main thoroughfare and the bus picks up and drops off fairly close. Pier 39 as well as Ghirardelli and the beach were very close

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: excellent. small and pretty, nice staff, great location
review.locationRemarks: civic center

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Older hotel. Needs some updating. Only 2 of us traveling for spring break so it was fine for us. Great location for taking transportation. City bus is $2 and takes you directly to fishermen's wharf and pier 36. Hotel is a close distance to Union Square for shopping. Walk only a few blocks up and take trolley to Chinatown. Fun experience. Recommend the Big Bus tour. Get 2 day pass and you can hop on and off at any stop and take night lights tour too! Golden Gate Bridge is a must. Sausalito is a quaint little town with great ambiance and great restaurants for eating!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for transportation to different sight seeing!
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Chinatown, Pier 36, Fishermen's Wharf, Little Italy and much more to do n see

review.title: We enjoyed our stay at the Opal, close to Muni
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very accommodating and helpful in planning our itinerary and helping us get from point A to B. The rooms were a little small but we weren't in it too much.
review.positiveRemarks: Affordable and why an older hotel, it is well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if they could vary their continental breakfast a little as it gets tired eating the same thing all the time.
review.locationRemarks: The bus stops right outside hotel that goes to Fisherman's Wharf and connect to the #5 bus which takes you to Golden Gate Park and the Pacific Ocean.

review.title: A night in the Tenderloin
review.reviewText: We came to the city to listen to the Lake Street Dive band. They happened to be playing at the Great American Music Hall. Though the drive back home would have only been 90 minutes or so, it was awesome to leave the show and walk a block and a half to our room. This also allowed us to enjoy ourselves and not worry about the drive. We woke up the next morning, enjoyed a nice continental breakfast and cruised on home.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was number 1, but the staff were very nice and the breakfast and hot coffee were perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have rather someone park my car for me, but all in all, parking next door at the movie theatre wasn't really that much trouble.
review.locationRemarks: If you don't mind a little walking, there's Union square about 7 blocks aways. A movie theatre right next door.

review.title: Bad outweighs the good
review.reviewText:
There are too many negative things with this hotel that outweigh the positives:

Pros:
- Hotel staff was friendly
- Pretty good complimentary breakfast
- Conveniently located within the city and near public transportation

Cons:
- Room was very small with very little room to walk around
- Cramped standing shower
- Lingering odor throughout the hotel
- No lock on bathroom door
- Additional $35 for car parking with a small spaces
- Need a special USB key to get in and out of hotel and gym that was not given to guests
review.negativeRemarks: See full review

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: The room was spcious, clean and the staff that welcomed us was very attentive. The bathroom was too small and had issues with hot water at times. The only complaint I have is regarding an employee(male Asian), the last day we were there, he was very sarcastic and had a condecending attitude(did not get his name). Over all we had a great time, everyone else who we spoke to had a great atttitude and were very helpful.

review.title: Nice, clean older motel with wonderful staff.
review.reviewText:
Staff was helpful and polite! No extras in the room though (no coffee pot, microwave, refrigerator). Breakfast is Continental (bagel, bread, muffin, coffee, etc - not a meal) Hotel is in an alright part of town with restaurants within walking distance. A short 5 block walk to the California line of the cable Car System. Be sure to get an extended stay pass that works for the duration of your stay (all day, 3 day, etc) that way you can get on and off as well as change lines and go wherever the Cable Cars go ( Lots of fun and easy to use). Parking at the hotel is expensive, but no more than daily parking anywhere else, as well as secure and using the Cable Car or bus system to get around is easy and inexpensive compared to finding and/or paying for additional parking.
.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities in the room - mini fridge, microwave, coffee pot.
review.locationRemarks: Short 5 block walk to the Cable Car system as well as immediate access to bus system. Found some variety of meal options within walking distance also.

review.title: nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Very charming old but very well kept and very clean and quiet staff were freindly and ver helpful

review.title: nice hotel transportation from hotel was excellent
review.reviewText: great staff, good breakfast clean rooms, restaurants close by, i loved the whole experience. Despite what i heard about the homeless situation i felt safe when walking around the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: laundry room, staff , breakfast and exersize room
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to union squar and shopping area .

review.title: Great home away from home.
review.reviewText:
I have only positive accolades concerning staff on all levels. I have stayed at the Opal over the years and love it.
Yet, I am saddened by management's recent decision to remove boiled eggs from the breakfast menu, and hence a main source of protein.

The only other material area to be improved would be having a refrigerator, particularly in the more expensive rooms. I would like to have cooled juices such as carrot, etc. not available for the three and half hour morning buffet. It would be a matter of convenience to be able to keep food/snacks/drinks in refrigerator rather than using the bathroom window sill hoping it remains cold enough. Obviously, in summer this does not work. There is no convenient organic health food store nearby, so I express this concern. I often travel to the Haight for such, and there is a Trader Joe's up Geary (on the 38 bus) and Masonic stop to the right. Yet again, it would be nice not to have to shop everyday for one's drink, other than tap water of course. There is ice available, but it is not sufficient to keep food or a large juice container cool for the next day.

Given the above two, I would go with the return of boiled eggs. I have always traveled out into the city, and realize that the expense of refrigerators would probably exceed the expense of the boiled eggs. Just my opinion, and does not alter my fondness for the Opal at all.
review.positiveRemarks: I like just about everyone and everything. The staff is pleasant and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Little needs improving, except the two areas I write above which are subject to the consideration of upper management.
review.locationRemarks: Particularly if you are or become comfortable with MUNI the Opal is a great location for a long stay all around San Francisco.

review.title: Nice 1908 hotel
review.reviewText: I felt like I was staying at my great-grandmother's house - but in the best way. The room was small but comfortable, the king size bed was big and comfortable, and the furnishings were much more beautiful than the typical 'modern' hotels' offerings.
review.positiveRemarks: I was able to walk everywhere I needed to go, and I felt safe.
review.locationRemarks: Mel's Drive-In (diner) on one side and a movie theater on the other were nice ways to relax between meetings.

review.title: Practically a motel in a less than fantastic area
review.reviewText: Be careful about what room you get. I suspect there are nicer rooms in the main building but we were outside in a "motel" area surrounding a parking lot. The room was nothing spectacular - old and worn carpet and bathroom needed updating. The lobby was nice and the breakfast was a nice bonus. It is next door to a Mel's drive-in which is convenient but other than that it is a distance to everything else in the city and sort of a less than glamorous area. The price may be a great deal if you can get an actual hotel room but after paying for parking and having a room overlooking the parking lot I think we could have gotten higher quality at a Best Western or Holiday Inn for the same price.

review.title: Thin walls
review.reviewText: The hotel was a cut above chain hotels in appearance. It was also a cut above in service. But the room was noisy. When you stay at a hotel, you can always hear your neighbors watching TV or talking in the hallway. This was noticeably louder at the Opal. Worse, I was next to the elevator, which dinged frequently. There are many other hotels nearby. If I'm in the area again, I'll give one of them a try.
review.negativeRemarks: Add noise canceling foam between the walls. Hell, add foam to the walls and call it functional decoration.
review.locationRemarks: The Tenderloin is close by and is a bit dangerous. Japantown is in walking distance.

review.title: Good spot on the cheap
review.reviewText: Good spot, decent amenities. The location is tricky: close to Market and on Van Ness, but too far south of the busy part of Downtown to be great for walking and not close to a BART.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: I had read reviews online. Our room was comfortable: good bed and free wi-fi. The complementary breakfast was a basic continental fare (no cereal or pancakes). Nothing over the top. Well staffed and a good occupancy, so we enjoyed our stay. We had a car and it did cost extra to park it. The hotel has two lots, both at the hotel. I had called and they had said parking was available and included, but the online reviews had told me differently, so it was not a real surprise that it cost extra. A car is a true luxury in S.F. We paid a lot for parking whenever we went out. If you can walk and take public transportation, you should. If you have an i-phone you can use the maps app to find your way around and you will be healthier for it. Bring your charger!

review.title: Reasonable for SF
review.reviewText: Cost makes this hotel worth the stay. It is reasonable price for SF.

review.title: Comfortable older hotel
review.reviewText: Older hotel that has been updated with fairly compact rooms. Staff are helpful and pleasant. Close to transit routes that will allow access to most city sights. Very good buffet breakfast. Good eateries close by.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed linen was a bit tired.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk to Civic Centre and Market Street, catch the Muni to Castro or the Ferry Building.

review.title: Very decent hotel
review.reviewText: I thought it was an "ok" hotel, I like how is near from everything (union square,city hall and other places).. I like the bed too! Plus their continental breakfast is good .. The only problem was that the toilet was clogged and even after they unclogged it at night ,the next day it got clogged again (fortunately we check out that day)..

review.title: Good value for low budgets
review.reviewText: Good value for your money. Room was small. It offers all you need when you're a tourist and basically just need a good place to sleep. Also offers a good breakfast buffet and has got an enthusiastic staff that go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your stay. However the area houses a lot of homeless people and you see people openly doing drugs and drinking when you walk the area. So when i extended my stay in the city I moved to a hotel a few blocks up on Van Ness Ave. When you chose to stay here, make sure you have your own transportation or use public transport to avoid walking the area. There's a bus stop right in front of the hotel. You should be fine then and there is no reason then to not give the hotel a try.

review.title: Nice location for downtown San Fransisco
review.reviewText:
It's a hotel: room, beds, bathroom. All seemed to be clean, no sign of undesirable bugs (Feb 3-5, 2014), Staff was pleasant and helpful (they called cabs for me daily), there were plenty of towels, washcloths and pillows. "Continental" breakfast was okay, they had a full supply of items (did not run out before 10), but in my world, a bagel and yogurt doesn't make breakfast.

Great location to downtown (I was attending a conference), tourist attractions, food. However, the road a couple blocks away (Howard) is packed full of homeless, so don't walk there.

Bed was a bit hard, but that's really my only complaint.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe some interior upgrades, everything inside appeared a bit aged.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to cable cars (takes you to golden gate, fishermans wharf, etc), nice access to restaurants,

review.title: A good hotel to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located, convenient and clean. The service is good,

review.title: Could be worse, but not worth the 'discount' price
review.reviewText:
These guys cheaped out on everything and the plumbing made showering extremely unpleasant and basically useless. It was either scalding hot or freezing. They gave us one tiny tube of shampoo for 2 people and no conditioner. No fans in the bathrooms led to a humid, sweaty room. The bed was very uncomfortable, the TV options were so limited it felt like the late 90s, the room was tiny, and they put a babysitter on the heater so we had to turn it back on every hour. Not knowing this and wanting to sleep through the night, we woke up freezing.

The Mel's downstairs and the general cleanliness of the rooms were the only upside. This place knows nothing about customer service and made it clear that their 'discount' rate if $100/night was coming straight out of your comfort and convenience. I would have done better at Motel 6. I might have at least been able to shower properly.

We arrived and checked-in, put our stuff in the room, walked to Union Square, to Market street and toured many Historic monuments at a miles reach without a problem. Enjoyed the stay and so did our three boys. Family friendly. BTW: the breakfast was small, but very good.

review.title: The Opal was very satisfactory
review.reviewText: The Opal was built around 1908 as a hotel and it still retains a modicum of charm. The rooms are comfortable, clean and good sized though not completely soundproof. The staff was extremely nice, friendly and knowledgable. The hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin which is seedy and populated by bums (there are bums everywhere in San Fran though) However the hotel feels very safe and the street it's on, Van Ness, is large and not seedy. Van Ness is a kind of divider between the tenderloin and another neighborhood and the location was actually quite good. It's 5 blocks from the Asian art museum and convenient to Polk which has a lot of good restaurants. There is a restaurant, Mel's Diner, which is in the hotel block and provides room service. Breakfast was toast, yogurt, fruit, boiled eggs, muffins and coffee. Across the street is a popular restaurant called Tommy's Joynt which serves large, cheap hunks-o-meat meals cafeteria style and is also historic (since 1947) and seemingly fairly unchanged. I'm a vegetarian so neither place appealed to me much but veggie options are everywhere in San Francisco. Up Van Ness is a good sushi place with 99 cent Sapporo drafts. I would stay here again.

review.title: Switched from an musty room to another
review.reviewText: At the time of check-in I asked if there were any special views. The front desk person told us the room being assigned was the last one left so there's no further choice. As soon as we entered the room, we encountered a musty smell. I called the front desk right away. A different front desk person answered the phone and she was able to make the switch right away in spite of the check-in clerk telling us this was the last room in the category. The new room did not have a musty smell so we stayed. The room was otherwise fine, though in the bathroom there some screw holes left, perhaps some bathroom fixtures were moved around. Other than just this one item, everything else about the hotel worked out well. The front desk, the breakfast waitress and other staff we encountered were quite helpful. The neighborhood could have been better but we didn't encounter any issues.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very nice except for the front desk person who assigned us the room with the musty smell. We bought the parking package, which was worth it.

review.title: A Terrrific Deal
review.reviewText:
This was a very pleasant place to stay, especially for the price. The staff was very professional, the room was immaculate, there was free coffee and tea downstairs in the comfortable lobby (most welcome after a sudden rainstorm), and the free breakfast was excellent, including peeled hardboiled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, and fresh bagels. I was impressed that the staff kept stocking the breakfast items right up until the official closing time; they also kept the breakfast room tidy.

Our room was somewhat small but with a huge bathroom; I assume it was a wheelchair accessible room and others might be larger. There was a good hairdryer, an iron, and a large t.v.

review.reviewText: I came with my daughters for the weekend to look at local colleges. From the minute we walked in I felt comfortable. The staff was extremely pleasant, especially Brad. I think that was his name. Even though a line was forming behind me, he took the time to allow us to check in early, explain the parking, told us how to get around. He was very helpful! I loved the feel of this old hotel, from the wooden staircases, especially the real narrow ones, to the stained glass windows. Especially loved the creaky floors and all the hallways when we went exploring! Breakfast got the job done, nothing special but satisfying. It would be nice if fresh fruit was offered maybe bananas, apples. Or cold cereal options. Area was typical for a city setting. Never once felt in danger. Would definetly stay again!!

In the meantime, management should invest in newer mattresses and pillows - Kleenex is thicker. The hotel is clean, secure, with friendly staff and is in dire need of modern update.

review.title: Good hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: Was wary of staying here because of the spotty reviews I had seen, but overall this is a very decent hotel for the price you pay. The front desk was very helpful with all of our questions on bus routes and how to get around the city, they provided a map of the city and recomended places we should visit. They also gave us a complementary bottle of wine when they found out we were on our honeymoon. We stayed in a deluxe king size room, it was nothing extraordinary but it had all the basics, which is what we needed since we were out touring the city most of the time anyways. I had no complaints on the bed and pillows, they were average and I slept just fine. The room was very clean. The complementary breakfast isn't as bad as some reviewers make it sound, they had bagels, different kinds of bread/toast, a few different kinds of muffins, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, and juice/coffee. Again, it was nothing extraordinary, but definitely good enough for a quick breakfast. The route 47 bus is right outside the hotel, which takes you to the Fisherman's Warf area, and has stops near the cable car routes as well. If you do venture out, don't go too far south (the "Tenderloin" area) we saw alot of homeless people, we didn't feel unsafe but it was a little sketchy, just stay on the main road (Van Ness) and you'll be fine.

Breakfast was decent but not great...preferred going to Mel's Diner right next door for a hearty breakfast. Thought this hotel would be convenient for Union Square shopping. Its pretty close on foot but the nieghborhood between the hotel and Union Square is a bit scary. So better to cab it...which we did. This hotal is great for visiting places on Van Ness i.e. city hall and the theatres etc.

review.reviewText: We had a good stay here with a spacious clean room. The public hotel areas are a bit tired and the free breakfast is very basic self service and very busy in a room that is too small to cope. The staff were lovely and very helpful and it was good value, we would stay again

review.reviewText:

We were able to talk to one of the staff members that shared it's history and even pictures of some research he did on it. The breakfast was a nice touch and it was great to have coffee and tea available 24 hours a day. Very safe hotel and convenient to bus lines. Staff were extremely nice and helpful.

A little pricey but Welcome to San Francisco!

review.title: Not bad for the price

review.title: Nice Hotel

review.positiveRemarks: The room which was recently renovated.

I didn't mind the down sides so I gave this a high rating..

Great for the price. If you don't mind outdated decor and a slight musty smell on the middle floors.

Breakfast decent. Room decent. Maid service great. Dry Cleaning great.

Area is a little rough. Loads of bum and crazies.. Which didn't bother me.

review.title: Great Choice for Outside Lands 2013.
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel 1 month in advance for Outside Lands 2013. Great price for the weekend, great location, plenty of restaurants and bars walking or taxi distance. About 3 miles from the festival gates so taxi is needed to and from the festival, suggest using Lyft because taxi wait times can be very long during this weekend. Overall look and feel of hotel is comfortable and clean, on site parking (with a fee) is a plus as long as you split it with your group. Front desk is friendly, free coffee and tea 24/7, continental breakfast is scarce so I suggest eating out for breakfast. Overall great SF experience would book again.

review.title: Nice old-school San Francisco hotel.
review.reviewText: We were in town for a quick overnight stay. Because we know what to expect in an old hotel in San Francisco, we were not expecting granite counters in the bathrooms and gigantic closets, or even a large room. We were surprised at the spaciousness of our room, which was described as a mini-suite. The bathroom was very small, as expected. When the owners upgrade next time, they should put in curved shower curtains so there is a little more room in the tub during showering. Our party consisted of three adults, and we had two queen beds which was fine. The biggest challenge was getting ready for a wedding the next day; with two women using the bathroom to get ready it was a little inconvenient. The lighting inside the room could have been better and so a person could use a mirror outside the bathroom for makeup etc. quite easily. And ironing a pair of black slacks in the dim room was difficult--I had to keep walking to a better lit area to see how I was doing. But the price was excellent. We didn't make it down in time for the breakfast. There were a lot of European travelers staying while we were there--the hotel must be on someone's list. It has a convenient location and the neighborhood seemed safe to us. I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very little outside noise (double windows), old fashioned charm. Reminded me of European hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting inside the room; curved shower curtain poles in the shower for more room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and the Civic Center.

The free continental breakfast was a good easy start to the day and had enough of a selection to be satisfying. Overall, I'd stay here again but probably wouldn't seek out this hotel specifically.

Park next door at AMC. Saves you $10/night and the exit is one door from the entrance to the hotel.

The rooms are adequate, with comfortable beds and all the necessities. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is pretty standard and not exceptional. For the price it's a good overall value.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel lobby needs to be updated and the continental breakfast could be improved.

review.title: Best Hotel for the money & location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a fancy room and upscale amenities, The Opal is not the place to stay. However, given the location and the rate per night; this is really the best hotel you can get for the money you are paying. The staff is very helpful and friendly, the rooms are a bit old and nothing out of the ordinary but my husband and I went to San Francisco to explore the city. I have no complains about this hotel. There is a gym and laundry facility onsite. The #1 pro about this Hotel is the location, honestly - my husband and I walked up and down Van Ness Avenue late at night and we felt totally safe. There is also a movie theater right next to the hotel, Walgreens & Starbucks within two blocks and great restaurant around the corner on Polk Street.
review.positiveRemarks: The #1 pro about this Hotel is the location
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are small and could use a slight renovation

review.title: Nice hotel for the money
review.reviewText: We had two rooms for our family vacation. One room was rather cramped with a shower that was too small for most adults. No my wife and I are not obese. The other room had a bathtub/shower and had counter space in the bathroom which was not present in the other hotel room with the small shower. Overall the hotel was good and we had no problem with the neighborhood it is in but it is just a few blocks from where San Francisco residents told us was a crime/drug ridden neighborhood. Again in all of our travels out of the hotel and to the tourist sites we used public transportation. We asked the hotel staff about the nearest place to rent a car for the day and was told about Enterprise rental which was over a mile down the road. However, upon walking we found a Hertz car rental three blocks away. The hotel staff should have known of that Hertz rental a few blocks away. Vending and ice machines are located on the third and fifth floor which is not too bad but the soft drink machine was out of most products. Restaurant that is connected to the hotel is a diner which is absolutely wonderful for your diner type meal. No it is not a five star restaurant but ALL the food is excellent.

Now on to the bad........the front desk staff is horrendous. They are not friendly, and seem depressed that they are working there. They keep pushing everyone to purchase the SF 'city pass'......I am not sure if they are on commission for getting people to buy this, save your money and go buy a MUNI pass......more worth it as you get access to all public transit (except the BART).

My advice to the hotel........fire everyone who is currently employed at your front desk and go hire competent qualified people to do the job.

review.title: First trip to San Francisco!
review.reviewText: My 25 year old daughter and I decided to travel to San Francisco for a 4 night stay. Although the Opal is an "older" hotel, it was beautifully maintained. All the staff were friendly and helpful. For instance, printed maps were available at the front desk and the staff (especially Bradley) would ask, "What's the plan for today?" and would then give suggestions. The complimentary breakfast was good with that staff being particularly attentive to hungry patrons in a hurry. The Opal's location could not be better, with ready access to restaurants and stores as well as bus, cab and cable car transportation. I would most definitely stay at the Opal in the future should that opportunity arise. We had a great time in this beautiful city and the Opal was a part of that!
review.positiveRemarks: Regarding the Opal, I was most impressed by its neatness and charm.
review.locationRemarks: Public transportation, including the famous cable cars, was readily accessible. We visited Fisherman's Wharf as well as Golden Gate Bridge and Park.

review.title: The Opal is ALMOST there
review.reviewText:
First time in SF for my partner and myself.
As with most places we stay, we chose The Opal based on reviews and location.
Situated on the corner of Van Ness and Geary
it was fairly easy for us to navigate around town.
Bus stop at short walking distance will get you to the wharf for 2 bucks.
Union Square about a 10-15mins stroll down Geary which was
great for us as there was a Hop-on Hop-off bus stop there which can
take you to most of the main tourist attractions around SF.
As many others have already mentioned (and i feel that i must)
Mel's Drive-In right next door is an asset for this hotel
- great food & great service.
So upon checking in we were greeted by a very polite lady
at reception. You will find most of the staff are friendly and attentative.
We were offered a room on ground floor, small, but cozy.
The room had a musky smell, thankfully not too overwhelming,
and we got used to it fairly quickly.
What i did find hard to get used to was the bell sound
from the elevator, everytime the doors open it sounds a loud chime,
it would echo straight down the hallway and into our room.
Aircon works great, wifi reception is good throughout.
A couple other notes i would like to mention are:
lack of in-room safe, and bathroom was a little small - even for us smaller people.
All in all not a bad stay, The Opal is a few tweaks away
from being a little gem.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator bell noise, no in-room safe, small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: fairly easy to get access to most tourist attractions

review.title: Okay hotel, not new, reasonable price
review.reviewText: The Opal is one of those classic downtown San Francisco hotels. It's a fairly old building that has been modernized reasonably well. The rooms have modern A/C and heat controls, which is a plus compared to other hotels I've stayed in downtown SF. The beds are really stiff and hard. The pillows could have been better. But generally, the rooms are nice. The staff are friendly and efficient. The continental breakfast was reasonable. The key advantage though was the room rates. The rates are very reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds are to hard. The pillows need some variety.

review.title: old style comfort ar great location
review.reviewText:
i enjoyed my stay very much. Personal was all very helpful. laundry facilities were available, breakfast was good (toast, muffins and bagels), coffe available at all times in the lobby with its nice easy chairs. Internet was working fine too ( i had other experiences).
Hotel is on major buslines going in all directions so just buy a day pass and get going!

review.title: Bargain hotel close to sights
review.reviewText:
This hotel turned out to be one of the best i stayed in during a recent month long trip in the USA. The location is within walking distance of sights although most may like to get a bus to the esplanade etc. The hotel, is located near Tenderloin, which is apparently an area well known for its dodgy characters. Having said that, although I did see quite a few homeless people nearby I never felt in any way unsafe or threatened during my stay - and i walked everywhere.

The staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. I was able to leave bags at the hotel for a trip to Yosemite. On my return I had a very pleasant surprise - i'd been upgraded to a larger room with a most comfortable king size bed.

Also worth noting are the nearby deli's and bars, where literally across the street you can grab an excellent cheap sandwich and beer from a vast selection till late at night. Near nirvana for those that like good beer and wholesome food at good prices.

All up a great hotel for the price. Thoroughly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly further from attractions than other hotels
review.locationRemarks: Great location within short bus ride or brisk walk to attractions. Safe despite appearances pf some locL characters

review.title: Central and close to many places.

review.title: Vacation stay in San Francisco at The Opal.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay at the hotel. The hotel is clean, and maintains it old character of S.F. . I would stay at the hotel again and recommend it.
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot think of any.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to many sites I wanted to see and walking distance to them.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: I was very pleased and would stay here again and again. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and they kept the coffee hot. After a long day of running around the bed was perfectly cozy and comfortable. There was no ac in the room but the large windows kept the room very cool. Room was small but to be expected....hey it's sf. The water pressure was great and the water nice and hot. The breakfast was continental but enough to get me un-hungry. Great place!!!

review.title: OK hotel, OK location, not so OK price.
review.reviewText:
The Opal is an OK hotel in an OK neighborhood. I felt completely safe here and in the surrounding areas, but not everyone would feel the same. We walked a half mile to an Avis car rental shop from the hotel and there are definitely some sketchy areas.

As for hotel itself, it is OK. It is mostly clean but with a bit of a weird smell to it. You can definitely tell it's an OLD hotel. As for the price, it's outrageously high compared to what you get. But then again, it is San Francisco and EVERYTHING is expensive.

Breakfast was decent, plenty of bread, cream cheese, juice, coffee and yogurt.
review.positiveRemarks: Only 1.5 mile walk or straight Van Ness bus line direct to Fishermans Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: funky smell in the room
review.locationRemarks: Decent location but not the best.

review.title: Great for all types of travelers
review.reviewText:
Initially they checked us into a room that was occupied, making it embarrassing for us and the people who were occupying the room at the time. Reception staff said it was a computer glitch and eventually apologized to us and the other party. Initially we were told someone could retrieve our boarding passes for us for the next day, but when we inquired at the front desk, we were told no. For the price of the hotel, the am breakfast needs an upgrade: They need to add a variety of bagels, cream cheese, fresh fruit, and hot and cold cereal.

The hotel is in a great location, near bus lines and the cable cars and of course a door from the lobby into Mel's diner. We stayed in the 2 queen bed suite, that was spacious and comfortable. The front desk staff needs to be a little more friendly and welcoming to their paid guests.

review.title: Nice hotel close to downtown.
review.reviewText: Nice,clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Good value. Was perfectly fine for a short business trip.

review.title: The staff needs help with kindness and knowledge.
review.reviewText: I asked for directions to the nearest parking garage (since they didn't state limited parking) and the front desk clerk acted like I was asking for the lottery numbers and she had no clue and no one else was of any help. The room was okay and not worth what I paid. I stayed at better motel 6's.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and knowledgeable staff.
review.locationRemarks: The Rib House down the street is a great place to eat.

review.title: OK for the price I paid.
review.reviewText:
The room had a strong smell. Not so much musty, but a mix between insecticide and dead rodent, it could have come from the AC ducts. The latter smell is something that can often be smelled in older buildings, esp. in the bay area it seems to me, in private houses as well as commercial buildings. I kept my clothes in the suitcase. Washed a T-shirt that I hung to dry and that smell was still in the fabric days after I left the hotel.

The building is old, some may say "old charm", and may expect this from San Francisco, but to me, the carpeting, the lobby furniture and color of paint are plain ugly - not very inviting and should be modernized.

The room was very clean.
review.locationRemarks: In order to get to Union Square, it's a ten minute walk down Geary, which is not the prettiest street for a few blocks.

review.title: Sketchy Neighborhood
review.reviewText: I got exactly what I expected, a good price. The hotel has a lot of potential and I think the owners could drive up rates if they invested a bit into decor and cleaning (and not the cleaning they are doing now with a strong and stringent anticeptic). The highlight of the hotel is the unaffiliated Mel's Diner in the same building. The low point of the stay was the sketchy neighborhood. I never felt in danger but if I was a single woman, I would definitely not want to be walking around there after dark. Wow! There are a lot of homeless people in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Secure on-site parking, nice gathering area in lobby, complimentary breakfast (of which I did not partake).
review.negativeRemarks: Change your cleaning products. Although I felt the hotel was clean, it smelled like a hospital ward with a stringent medicinal smell.
review.locationRemarks: I had a conference in a very expensive hotel nearby so to save money for my company I searched for a deal and walked the 8 blocks to Union Square.

review.title: A good value
review.reviewText: The Opal is a decent hotel with clean rooms and a friendly staff. My basic needs were met well. The hotel and room were clean, and for an old hotel has been kept up nicely. The location isn't great being very close to the Tenderloin Disctrict with all it's homeless, druggies, and beggers. On our way back from our conference we were approached near the hotel front door by an incredibly dirty and smelly individual begging for any money we could provide. It's not the hotel's fault, but their proximity to Tenderloin is unfortunate. As it is in San Francisco the parking was very expensive, and there was no mini-fridge or coffee pot in the room. The television reception was poor, but I was at a conference most of the time so didn't care.

photos.caption: The largest closet I've ever seen!
Pleasant bathroom with a slightly confusing shower

review.title: Good value for money, clean and nice breakfast
review.reviewText:
Hotels in San Francisco are fairly expensive, but The Opal is good value for money. I've seen some negative comments about the breakfast, but I was very pleased - juices, coffee, tea hot chocolate, boiled eggs, bagels, toast, muffins, cream cheese, jam, fruit and yoghurt - not a bad spread at all.

The decor is a little outdated, but the hotel was clean and my room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. Some people indicated that the area was a bit "sketchy", but I felt perfectly safe and the staff were very welcoming. I would recommend this to someone that was on a bit of a budget - and my only negative is that it's probably a bit far out if you want to walk to the touristy bits - about 40 mins walk away from Pier 39 etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, value for money, quite room and comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: Location was a little far out, decor was a little tired

The hotel is clean, nicely appointed and comfortable. I wouldn't complain about room size. It's typical of a hotel from the early 1900's. Continental breakfast was ok, but if you want something heartier go to Mel's next door. Others have complained about the price to park but it's typical for SF. We were in town for a medical appointment at UCSF Mt. Zion. Just a 5 min drive and another $20+ to park for half day. Overall nice place to stay. They should send their staff to In and Out Burger to learn manners and good customer service.

review.title: A disappointing stay.

Everything looked and felt old and rugged. The breakfast was extremely limited. The location is close to the center of activities in the city but the neighborhood is a bit rough. I had a room close to the street, which was noisy at night. The experience was nowhere close to what I expected from the price. I would not stay at this hotel again if I had a another chance to visit San Francisco.

review.title: Cute hotel in central location.
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Opal hotel for one night and we were very pleasantly surprised. Very welcoming staff, I especially liked Brad. The bathrooms are cute and clean and so are the rooms. Beautiful lobby and the place has lots of vintage character. Great place to stay if you're looking for an easy, no-fuss hotel in a central location.
Thank you Opal! We will be back. :)

review.title: Great hotel and great service
review.reviewText: Checked in at the Opal for my anniversary and we were welcomed warmly by the front desk. She was very nice and booked us in very easy. The hotel itself was nice and every staff member or even the room service says hi all the time. Free breakfast was awesome, and the hotel is clean as well. It is very cheap to check in, but I was surprised of how good quality the hotel was. Definitely gonna come back here if I want to spend the night in SF.

Only minus is that no tea/coffee facilities in room, but a minor inconvenience really. Location on Van Ness Avenue is just a couple of blocks away from one of the tram turnarounds, and whilst the hotel is fairly central in the city, we found that the Muni bus/tram pass at $22 for 3 days was good value and probably needed even for the more expensive wharf side hotel locations.

More importantly, be ready to pay up 20+ dollars for parking everyday, that's if you use the parking building between the hotel and theatre (3 minutes walk). Or you'll pay $35 If you choose to park in the Hotel's parking lot (Which i found about by myself after staying their for 2 days). The staff never told me about their parking lot.

review.title: Great place to stay.

I truly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was fabulous and the continental breakfast was great too. I appreciated the well kept workout room. If there is not enough equipment for you, the hotel is right next to a 24 hour fitness.

review.title: Nice stay in San Francisco

The staff was friendly and helpful. I would return to the Opal Hotel San Francisco.

Parking is about $35 per day but totally worth it since parking is very expensive around. Extended my days due to loved the location and staff. Will definitely stay again when traveling. Opal is a great place and affordable place to stay in.

review.title: Awesome!

review.title: Great base for a family holiday

Mels Diner next door is a good choice for evening meals if don't want to venture too far. Staff very helpful in answering any queries.
review.negativeRemarks: No bar

review.title: Easter Trip
review.reviewText: Very busy but you are number one when spoken to; Had a group with four rooms, first time I have had no one in the group whine about anything the hotel had, FIRST TIME! If a hotel can do this for me, hallelujah! Rooms excellent (one a disability room, very accessible), restaurant close by, continental breakfast (crowded but still a cheerful staff trying to serve everyone, patience a must) room, parking on site good once you obtain it (street parking until you check in), housekeeping on top of things and overall desk staff very helpful and informative. Old feel of the hotel was also a plus.

review.title: nice stay

The motel was an older building, but it has been restored beautifuly.We got a deluxe room with queen beds. It also came with a fold out couch that wasnt advertisef but came in handy. The beds were super comfy. The staff was really nice. The cleaning ladies us back into our room for my sick son even aftetrwe checked out
The room did lack in the area of air conditioning. ..other than that it was great!

review.title: Convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at The Opal! It was an awesome location and we were able to easily access the BART and Muni. The room was large and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff was exceedingly helpful and friendly and even let us use their computers when the wireless was down for a few hours. The complimentary continental breakfast is such a time and money-saver. We very much enjoyed our stay and would surely stay here again next time we visit SF.

review.title: not good.

review.title: Hotel is "historic" and with "historic" comes.....

review.negativeRemarks: Rude individuals at the free continential breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: On major street that connects marina district/ piers 39/ 33 and Market street. Makes using the MUNI transit system very effective.

review.title: Good downtown hotel

She was very helpful and got us out of a few pickles when we needed help. Good hotel, a little expensive. Expedia helped us out though. Breakfast was mediocre. No cereal, no fruit, just toast ,boiled eggs, and yogurt.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff were excellent

review.title: SF's (OPAL HOTEL) Inconvenience!

Ice machines should be on every floor.

review.negativeRemarks: Paying additional for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location.

review.title: A Good Hotel
review.reviewText: A good hotel, courteous staff, in an area away from the main tourist neighbourhoods but accessible by public transportation.

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText:
Very nice, and the staff were all so nice.
We liked that it was very secure, and you had to use your key or buzz to get in hotel.

review.title: Opal is an small, clean and well located Hotel
review.reviewText:

review.title: Great hotel far large families.

Very convenient location to many areas and dining, including Mel's Diner (American Graffiti movie) attached to the hotel. Our Junior Suite slept six; for a family this size it's next to impossible to find accommodations in a cities like San Francisco. Staff was very helpful. Be prepared to pay $30 per night for the hotel parking garage, but it is a secure garage. You will pay similar prices everywhere else in San Francisco. You may find cheaper, but they are open lots without security. 38 Bus line runs right next to the hotel to Union Square. All in all a nice stay.

review.title: Upmarket hotel without the price tag.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is on the 'lower' side of Vermont Ave however it is anything but lowbrow! It is quite up-market with large rooms, wonderful decor and easy access to all we needed or wanted. The room we stayed in was at the front so it overlooked the street. The traffic was noisy during the day (like all other main streets) and it did quieten down at night so we were able to sleep soundly.

The free breakfast buffet provided a large variety of foods in a relaxed environment. I really liked the layout of the 'egg station' so I could watch my omelette being created.

Bus stop is outside the door and the underground train station is a short walk away.

The only downside to my stay was having to pay an additional $20 per night for parking at the actual hotel. The good side to that was that it was a "daily" rate, so we could come and go all we wanted without incurring further costs.

review.title: Clean, affordable, full-service hotel
review.reviewText: Normally stay at the Holiday Inn Golden Gateway, but got a much better deal online at the Opal (four blocks away from HI GG). Great location (on Van Ness) -- not in the heart of town or Union Sq, but a short walk to everything. The Opal is a mid-priced, full-service hotel. Older hotel, but well-maintained. Room was clean (including bathroom and bathtub).. Bed was very comfortable (I had a king-sized bed). Basic cable only on TV (if this is important to you). The front desk staff is wonderful -- very positive and helpful. Less than a block from a major movie theater (AMC 14). Mel's Diner is next door with early and late hours. Complimentary continental breakfast every morning. Wine reception every Wednesday. Windows open. Some street noise with windows open (Van Ness is a major street), but very quite with windows closed. No noise from other rooms. No views in the 5-floor Opal, whereas most rooms in HI GG facing Nob Hill have views. I stayed at the Opal for 14 nights in December 2012. I would seriously consider staying at the Opal again when I return to SF. .

The entire hotel - the lobby, lifts, and the room itself were very dated and in desperate need of a renovation. Also the "free breakfast" was a joke. It was essentially coffee, a muffin, a hard boiled egg, and some toast. The free wifi worked quite well, although we needed to re-login every day which was a bit annoying.

I can't complain too much because given the location we got it for a very affordable price. I'd say if you're after an affordable hotel in the heart of San Francisco this is a good place, however don't expect much.

If I ever have a reason to visit San Francisco again, I won't even waste my time looking for other options. Also, I've seen reviews that say this is in a questionable neighborhood. review.title: Great location and great service
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco, and I found that the hotel choice was great. The location was very central and was on one of the major streets in the city, so it was easy to use public transportation to get around and explore all over the city. The staff were very helpful, they booked some of our tours for us directly there and made recommendations of things to do. The room was a little small, but the beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and I felt very safe. Breakfast was included, it was pretty basic (toast, muffins, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit and juices), but was enough to get the day started. I strongly recommend taking a shuttle to the hotel from the airport, we chose to take the BART, but the walk was longer than I expected, uphill and in a sketchier part of town which didn't give the greatest first impression... we took the shuttle back to the airport when leaving and it was a much smoother way to get there. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

review.title: enjoyed our stay at the Opal
review.reviewText: The hotel is not in a good neighborhood would be my only complaint. However, we just kept walking to our desired destination and were not bothered by anyone. The hotel staff is the best. We did not like the accomodations at first (location to elevator and view) and the staff (the manager) upgraded our room at no additional costs. They were very kind and helpful. Always interested in making sure we got the most out of our visit to San Francisco and seemed to enjoy hearing stories of our adventures. They made recommendations, helped us book excursions, helped us locate affordable transportation, and were always willing to call for any further clarification needed. The manager checked us in for our return flights as well. I can't say enough about the staff at the hotel. Our room was clean and the housekeepers always paid close attention to our time schedule. The breakfast lacked a little variety, but the breakfast host was very kind and always kept things fully stocked even on the busiest of days. If we made a return visit to San Francisco we would stay at the Opal again.

The door knobs on the bathroom door were not put on securely, when I tried to get out of the bathroom the nob kept spinning. I had to do a Mcguyver.

review.title: Great & convienent
review.reviewText: The rooms are nice. We stayed in a mini suite. One bed was in need of more support at the head of bed. Sleeper sofa in room comfortable and wasn't expected. Closet needs light but big! Bath very comfortable. The resturant - Mel's Dinner attached to hotel was too pricey for what you got. However just across the street is Tom's Tavern - fabulous deli sandwiches...and dinners. Polk street not far with lots of dining choices...AMC movie theatre on the next corner! We'd stay again!

review.title: Fun in the city

review.locationRemarks: Not a bad walk to most things to do in the city. Plenty of parking around that you don't need to pay $30 to park at the hotel.

review.title: Outdated and dirty hotel!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: small things make a deffrence. guest laundry, free coffee, atm. great location.

review.title: Great deal!
review.reviewText: A very good deal in the heart of SF -- close to Japan Town and a 15 minute walk to Chinatown. I really liked my room. Breakfast could be better but a nice wine and cheese reception on Wednesday night. Shower was small and water pressure low, but overall the Opal is a bargain.

review.title: Opal Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was well located as it is halfway between UCSF / Golden Gate Park and the financial centre / Chinatown areas. It was well-connected by buses to the various centres in San Francisco. It was however only two blocks from the Tenderloin or rough part of town. This area was not fierce but one had to be wary.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was well located and bus-connected but only 2 blocks from rough part of town.

review.title: Not safe
review.reviewText: The smell of the entire place was horrendous. We discovered refried beans clumped on the bedspread. The staff was a little too pushy toward particular tours over others. It was clear they have "arrangements" with several tour bus operators, which is fine but let the customer decide once all the information is presented. I won't recommend this hotel to others. Plus, it is not in a safe location...one block from the tenderloin district.

review.title: Solid hotel, pretty good location
review.reviewText:
This hotel was definitely a bargain as compared to a lot of other hotels in SF. Its right on the outskirts of the Tenderloin and Nob Hill and at night doesn't really have that rough of a street scene (unlike deeper into the Tenderloin). If you are from any other big city, you will find this neighborhood to be just fine.

The rooms were spacious and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We were able to store out bags there during our final day after check out which was great! We didn't get around to having a continental breakfast, but it didn't really look like a whole lot and also Mel's was right next door and open late. We were walking to/from city hall each day and it was a easy (not that hilly) walk down and back.
review.negativeRemarks: A few stains
review.locationRemarks: Awesome, if you don't mind the occasional homeless person! Cmon though you have to expect homeless people in a city like SF.

review.title: OK, basic hotel. Did the job.

OK, rooms with two doubles have no view. No tea/coffee maker in rooms.
That said, all the basics are there and the rooms were kept clean.
Expect to pay for a few taxis. To Fishermans Wharf is typically $10+tip.
Desk staff are happy to help with anything. Breakfast is very basic too, but Mels Diner is right next door if you want to fill your belly. :)
Tommys Joynt is also across the street too.
The neighbourhood is a little rundown, but we didnt feel threatened wuth two kids during the day. Garage charge is extra with in/out priveliges.

The hotel charges $34 dollars a night to park. Next door to the hotel is a parking garage which charges $22 a night for parking. I suggest you walk the extra fifty feet and save some money.

review.title: I'd stay at the Opal again
review.reviewText:
My daughter and I stayed two nights at the Opal. Lots of European guests which gave it a cosmopolitan feel for a reasonable price.

We walked downtown from there, and it doesn't take long but here's my big caveat; when leaving the hotel, go right toward Geary before heading down! If you turn left then follow O'Farrell, you're smack in the Tenderloin and it isn't a pleasant walk.

That said, if you like thrifting, the Goodwill store on Geary is a good one!

The hotel itself is comfortable and clean. Fine if you're like me and only use a hotel to sleep and shower in. Our room didn't face the street and it was quiet enough for me. I didn't hear other guests through the walls either.

Avoid Mel's unless you want an overpriced, ersatz American diner experience.

review.title: Recommended for short stay in SF

Breakfast was uninspiring but to be honest I don't think American hotels will ever do breakfast in the same way British and European hotels do! - we didn't encounter any better breakfast options on our whole trip apart from the Amargosa Opera House in Death Valley.
We weren't allocated adjacent rooms - in fact our kids were two floors away, which was fine for us as they are teenagers but would have been an issue for younger or less confident kids.
The location is good - we walked to Fishermen's Wharf from there (though it was quite a long walk back again!!) - not too noisy and easy to find again. Grocery shops nearby and transport to Chinatown etc not too far to walk to.
Staff were knowledgeable and helpful.

The up sides are that it's clean, decent sized rooms, the hotel has a neat look and feel and it's close enough to walk to a lot of great touristy areas. The down sides are that it's in a kind of rough neighborhood (but a couple blocks in either direction and it's ok). Mel's, the 'room service restaurant' is pretty terrible. The hotel's 'continental breakfast' was REALLY depressing. It was some picked over fruit, fake yogurt and a few loaves of cheap bread and some toasters (all three days we were there). Parking was $30 a day and finding parking on the street is impossible - so add $30 to your expected daily room rate. All in all, we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel or depend upon it for breakfast and it was great as 'a nice place to crash' so it was non offensive.

review.title: Family stay for four days in San Fran
review.reviewText:
The good:
Location - this hotel is at a point for easy access to public transit all over the city.
The cost - affordable
The upkeep - for an aging inner city motel, it appears well looked after
The beds - Firm, yet comfortable
Noise attenuation - Despite traffic, it was quiet on the third floor and the street noise was scarcely audible.

The bad:
Location - The hotel is in a good neighborhood, but going east on foot exposes you to areas with many homeless and blatant use of recreational drugs.
The thermostat - The hotel uses programmable thermostats and has instructions for override. The problem we had was the thermostat being set by us for a/c then reverting to the heater in the middle of the night and the room going from comfortable to 74 F and needing to shed covers.

The indifferent:
Breakfast - It was there every morning, and depending on your hour of use depended on the limited selection available beyond toast. For those needing more than coffee, toast and yogurt in the morning, plan to purchase breakfast.
Room size - The rooms are small, but what do you expect from an inner city motel? The larger closet in out room helped alleviate having bags in the way.

review.title: It's a hotel.
