review.locationRemarks: Near some iffy neighborhoods, but nothing bad before very late at night.

review.title: Good value for money, great location
review.reviewText: The Opal was a good choice for us (2 adults, 2 kids). As with most urban hotels in this price range, the rooms are smallish. We had a window overlooking a busy street but the rooms have excellent windows and there was minimal noise. We appreciated the great service provided by the staff and the very adequate breakfast to start the day - read complaints about it that must have come from people expecting a cooked breakfast (for this price??). There are hard boiled eggs, breads, muffins, fruit, yogurt, juices, and coffee/tea/hot cocoa. Coffee and tea are available 24/7 in the lobby. Would stay again - bus stops right out front that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance to Union Square, or short bus ride - get a muni pass (or City Pass - we used ours multiple times every day for transport and entry to many events/attractions). No car needed in SF! Plus the parking fee at hotel is pricey.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, nice breakfast, great location esp to access public transportation

review.title: Great hotel for healthy/well fit adults w/ budget
review.reviewText:
I, my husband and two daughters stayed here for just one night. We probably would not stay here again, but we never had any problem. It was clean and staff were friendly. For the price of hotel in SF, it was just fine.
We had much higher expectation before arriving the hotel. The hotel picture looked very nice on the website, but the building was old. There were homeless people behind the hotel alley. The room was small and there was only a shower, not tab. The hot water did not last for two people to take shower right after the other. The parking space was tight. The parking cost was $35.00 plus tax per night. The continental breakfast was o.k. It was just enough to start the day, not impressive.
We walked to Japan Town (4 blocks away), but we would not walk to any other sight seeing spots with two kids. (It was just too far for kids to walk up the SF hill back to hotel).
This hotel maybe o.k. for healthy/well fit adults with limited budget.

review.reviewText: We were checked in by the same person; Carlo, that checked us in on previous visits. It made for a good beginning to a very enjoyable stay. As in the past our room was very comfortable and was adequate for our needs. The breakfast setup was very pleasant and had a deverse choice of items. Fortunately there is on sight parking, although a little pricey. The check out, by Angela, was quick and pleasant. We will stay at the Opal again.

review.title: The Opal is a pleasing gem
review.reviewText: The Opal is an old fashioned hotel that has been remodeled/modernized. My room had a good quality king size bed and was quiet - the walls prevented excessive noise transmission. The carpeting was fairly clean - no black bottoms on my socks. The shower was very good but the tub floor was a bit slippery. A hair dryer, iron and ironing board were included. There was no coffee maker in the room. However, fresh regular and decaf coffee and hot water along with condiments were always available in the lobby. The continental breakfast was adequate and appreciated. Food supplies were well maintained and the dining area was clean. I would stay there again.

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was clean, but rather dingy and run-down in appearance. Also, the large crack under the door allowed in bright light from the outside hallway at night, making it difficult to sleep. The price was a big plus, as it was very inexpensive to stay here, but the neighborhood was pretty scary after night-fall with lots of homeless people/drug addicts wandering around the area, some of which harassed us on our return to the hotel at night. We did not feel safe walking to a restaurant after dark. Also, parking was expensive, but this is to be expected in a large city.

Overall, you have to weigh your options. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay that is reasonably clean, this is it. But don't stay here if you are looking for an upscale or romantic experience.

review.title: Great older hotel

We weren't looking to spend a fortune for one night so The Opal had a decently priced room for us. Reviews did say that the hotel was old but was very clean and comfortable. I agree with those reviews. Much older then we are use to but everything was very clean and functioning. Rooms were small but no outside noise couldn't be heard. No microwaves or fridge so keeping leftovers isn't likely. Beds were so comfortable!!! Staff was great. Parking is going to be expensive it was $30 a night but that is pretty standard in SF. Didn't get a chance to have breakfast because we checked out at 6am. We would stay here again for short trips but maybe find something a little more accommodating for longer stays.

review.reviewText:
We paid more to get the location and parking (an additional $30/day) and both were worth it. It's a great location, being on Van Ness, easily accessed from the highways, and a direct drive across the city to Fishermans Wharf.

The room was small, but much quieter than expected. Many hotels are their own worst enemy as far as noise goes, but the elevator was quiet, the ice machine room was behind a thick door, and the heating/AC went on and off with air noise but no loud buzz. A hotel in the city is going to have a lot of traffic noise but this was more bearable than most.

Internet was free! That's unusual for hotels in this price range. Perhaps to make up for that, they not only charge for printing, but they require a minimum $5 credit card charge. Really annoying for doing a boarding pass.

The continental breakfast is muffins, yogurt, mixed melon, and toast, plus coffee and juice. Eh, but again more than hotels often provide, and the coffee was decent. Mel's Diner, a 50's retro-diner, is attached, and open late.

review.title: At the Opal for a Month

The staff was helplful and asked about our relative's condition each time we passed the desk. They were accommodating when we needed to extend days. An ample continental breakfast is provided with toast, muffins, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea and juice every morning. There is a smally exercise room an laundry facility. The bus stop is right outside. There are not a lot of good restaurants close, but Mel's Diner is next door--clean but a little pricey for a diner. We walked to one good Thai restaurant and others were just a short bus ride away There were lots of European travelers staying at hotel and it was interesting to hear all the languages at breakfast. Some homeless on the streets, but all in all we'll be back.

review.title: A hotel isn't a hotel if you can't sleep in it.
review.reviewText:
Cool hotel. Central location. Even has a Mel's diner attached. The room was small but nice, bathroom worked properly, parking was fairly easy.

But I got NO sleep. Oh my god, the locks on the doors are INSANE. When you put your key in, the lock emits a loud, high-pitched beep. Then there's a clunk as the lock disengages. Another clunk as you turn the handle. And you can't shut the door quietly from the outside, so 50% of the time there's also a loud clunk as the door closes and locks again. All night long, all over the hotel, that's all I could hear. After hours of having my pillow over my head, I ended up getting dressed at 1am, going for a walk, and hanging out with the bums on Van Ness Avenue. We had to postpone leaving for a day and find another hotel, since there was no way I could drive back to Los Angeles on zero sleep.

Aside from those doors, this would have been a four- or five-star review. But, as nice as everything else was, a hotel isn't a hotel if you can't sleep in it.
review.negativeRemarks: The horrible sleep I got there.

review.title: Now we have OUR hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
A charming old hotel that has been scrupulously refurbished without being "modernized" to death. Yay! Room, bathroom and public areas were clean to a fare thee well. The staff couldn't have been more welcoming or more efficient. I mentioned at check-in that we came to S.F. to celebrate my birthday with old friends, and the desk manager picked up the phone and I heard her say, "Put a bottle of wine and two glasses in room 524." It was there by the time we got off the elevator. The parking ($25 extra per night) was VERY convenient--they give you a remote control so you just pull into and out of the parking lot like it was your own garage. Mel's Diner, their lobby restaurant, had great hamburgers and pie. The hotel's free breakfast was fine. My only complaint is the walls are a bit thin and the woman in the next room one night had a loud voice. Eh? Who spends time in the hotel when you're in San Francisco!
When we go back for the opera season, we will definitely stay at the Opal next year.

review.title: A Bargain With Conditions
review.reviewText:
The Opal Hotel is located at the intersection of Van Ness Ave. and Sutter St in downtown San Francisco. It is a central location for travelers on a budget who would prefer to be near everything without having to stay in a distant motel or a seedy rooming house. It is not a sleek, modern hotel nor is it the Four Seasons. However, for the money it works just fine for those who know where they are going in SFO and simply don't want to break their budget. I rented a family suite that slept 2 grown-ups and 3 teenagers comfortably. The continental breakfast is complimentary and really helps the wallet. The hotel is on busy Van Ness Avenue and just 3 blocks from the California St. Cable Car stop. It is also just a 20-30 minute walk to the Wharf or the Financial district.
It should be noted that some of the side streets near the hotel appear a little spooky at night with street characters looming in the shadows. Just know your surroundings and have your street smarts on alert and you will have no problems. The hotel wanted $35 a night to park (and a large refundable deposit for the garage door remote). I found a better option 2 blocks away for $22 a night, but carefully read the hourly rate sign and understand the hours of operation.
Perhaps most importantly, the staff at the Opal were just great to us. They were cheerful and most helpful with our various requests. We would stay there again without any hesitation.

review.title: Surprisingly great
review.reviewText: You can't beat the service here. The people at the front desk are among the nicest that we have met at any hotel. Very helpful and willing to do anything that you need. The hotel has a nice feel to it as well. Overall a very nice experience.

review.title: Not bad for a one-star hotel.
review.reviewText: Considering how old this hotel is and for the price, you "do" get what you pay for. The nicely renovated lobby area does not paint a real picture of the room you end up with. Just be aware. The maids did an excellent job in upkeep of the room however. Rooms might be old but they do an excellent job of keeping it clean for you. However, considering how close my room was to Van Ness, it was surprisingly quiet. And the air conditioning system was also surprisingly quiet. Al in all, if you ignore the age of the room itself, and all you really want is a really comfortable bed to sleep in, this "is" the place! Not at all that bad for a place to sleep. Just don't expect any more than that!

Mediocre quality of room. Benefit is a continental breakfast but does not outweigh poor customer service and low quality of room. Book at your own risk.

review.title: The Opal is a gem.
review.reviewText:
Thw hotel Opal is located about four blocks freom the California line cable car-easy walking distance. Several buses go right by on Van Ness Avenue- the central location was great. The Opal is located beside Mels Diner and across the street from Tommy's Joynt, both reasonably priced establishments with good quality homestyle food. The hotel itself is older but well maintained and it has beautiful stained glass in the lobby. The staff are excellent- friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and multi-lingual. There is complimentary coffee and tea available in the lobby 24/7 and a continental breakfast ,which is adequate but with limited selection.
I would recommend this gem to anyone.
review.locationRemarks: Haight-Ashbury has great little restaurants, unique shops many of which have vintage clothing and memorabilia and of course interesting residents. It has apparently changed a great deal from the sixties and early seventies but it still has a relaxed, tolerant vibe.

review.title: Wonderfu Van Ness location

Easy to catch bus and very safe to walk (as this is also Hwy 101). Hotel had easy to adjust air cond/heat (where many places just have windows to open). Don't care about breakfast much,so just grabbed coffee and yogurt (I don't like to read reviews that score a hotel low just because people don't like the continental breakfast). Easy walk to Market St., Union Square, Octavia/Hayes area. Will make this my hotel of choice in San Fran (most wonderful city ever)

review.reviewText:

We arrived at the hotel at 10am and left bags with conceirge so we could go exploring til the checkin time at 3pm.

Breakfast was basic, toast, coffee, orange juice and muffins. Expedia booking said breakfast not included so it was a nice surprise to get it anyway.

The local neighbourhood was full of homeless, particularly the Civic centre area. I've never seen so many homeless people all over the streets! But if you want to get to the Fishers Wharf area or the Embarcdero area you can easily avoid the homeless concentration Civic area by taking O Farrell street all the way east. Or head up Van Ness north all the way north to Fishermans wharf. So its an OK location, bit of a walk but we love it.

review.reviewText: This hotel was so beautiful! It is a very old hotel but is well taken care of. The room was much larger than I expected. I was very happy with everything except the breakfast. It was very small and not much variety.

review.title: Will Stay anytime we are in the city
review.reviewText: This Hotel was wonderful for what we needed. One night stay over. Parking excellent. safe remote control gate with in and out privileges. Bathroom very small but all we needed. My "ONLY" negative, is the quality of the Free Continental Breakfast. Toast, Mini muffins. Juice coffee, canned fruit. Oh and a big stack of peeled hard boiled eggs, that is all that we were offered on the morning we were there, but who cares!, connected to the Hotel lobby is Mel's Diner. Have breakfast there, and this is prefect for a couple who does not plan on spending long stretches of time inside the room. Self Laundry Room, wonderful exercise room. Will definitely stay again.

review.title: Would not stay again in this hotel, unless I go with somebody else.
review.reviewText:
This Hotel was fine for the price. It is an old building, but is not bad. The room was clean. It had cable, but regular channels, but not movie channels. There was not noise from the outside which I found nice to sleep. What I did not like was the neighborhood, it is not a nice one, there were a lot of people asking for money, and people with not a very good appearance at all. I walked 10 blocks to get to Union Square, and since I was by myself I felt unsafe throughout my 10-block walk.
Nothing happened to me, but I was not eager to go outside, I kind of dread it. I would not recommend this hotel, if you are a woman by yourself and if you are planning on walking as a tourist.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We were a litte disappointed when we first arrived because the rooms are very small however after you get used to the size of the rooms everything else was great. The management accomodated all our needs immediately when asked. The location is excellent for easily getting to all the sites that we wanted to visit. We would stay again at this hotel.

review.title: Excellent customer service.
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms were comfortable, not too noisy. Beds were clean and comfortable. About a 9-12 block walk to main attractions, so bring good walking shoes.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The bed was comfortable, the staff pleasant but the continental breakfast was not really worth advertising. We went over to Mel's Diner both mornings for a decent breakfast. The hotel is in the Tenderloin area of SF. Interesting... but you would not want to walk around at night.

review.title: A Nice Stay For the Price
review.reviewText:
A great hotel for the price and location. If you're the kind of person who wants to spend all of your vacation in your hotel room, you might find these rooms small, but who goes to SF to stay in the hotel? The room is clean, has all the basic necessities, and is quiet enough for an in-city area. Oh, and the shower in my single king room, was so nice and spacious I was instantly won over!

And for those that worry about the neighborhood, if you've every lived in a city before you've probably been through far worse. I walked around the area past midnight and felt just fine.

The only real problem I saw (and luckily I managed to avoid) is that parking in the area is very dear, and their tiny (i.e. claustrophobic) basement lot fills up quickly. It might be worth it to see if you can reserve a spot ahead of time.

Its no 5 star resort, but if you're looking for a good SF hotel on a budget I'd try this one.

review.title: Poor service
review.reviewText: When we got there - the reservation was wrong. I placed a reservation for a two bed room for two adults. It was one bed - they would/could not change it because they were "full". When we requested extra blankets - they said they would deliver right away - they never showed.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel to stay at. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The complimentary "continental breakfast" is more like toast and hard boiled eggs and could very well be improved. They need to upgrade their internet to WI-FI asap! The location is nice, yet it is a bit pricey.

review.title: A bit afraid of what it would be like at first... but then, pleasantly surprised.
review.reviewText: I have to admit it is in a seedy part of town, but it's San Fransisco and it was fun. Nobody tried to bother us, the rooms were old, but clean. We heard some people yelling outside at night, but again, it was exciting and we were not afraid. The staff was very friendly and it worked out to be a great trip. By the way, we took a light to see if there were "bed bugs" and there were none. Slept well!

review.title: Acceptable for the Price
review.reviewText: The Opal Hotel is located on the edge of the Tenderloin District in San Francisco. While daytime walking through the Tenderloin is probably safe, it is definitely not a safe area to walk in the evening. That said, the hotel is well priced for the location, which is about ten long walking blocks to Union Square. The rooms are adequate though not updated. The staff acts rather casually to complaints and requests, including courtesy at check-in. It appears that many foreign visitors and some groups utilize the hotel which may account for this attitude of complacency. The breakfast seems to have improved since comments made by others. While lacking yogurt and cereal, it's certainly an acceptable continental-style breakfast. Our only major complaint was that we were given a room in the "motel-like"portion of the hotel. When we asked why, we were told that rooms were given out in the order of check-in. Though the room was what we requested and it was quiet for the most part, we had to walk out of the hotel and around the inside parking lot to get to the room. This wasn't a great inconvenience for the two nights we stayed there, but the explanation seemed inadequate to us. Some travelers could be upset by this development. We were offered the chance to change rooms for the second night, but did not want to move our items for the one remaining night. Overall, this is an acceptable hotel as long as you don't pay the posted prices.

review.title: Was very much what we wanted at a decent price.
review.reviewText: Very nice "Boutiquey" Hotel. Only complaint is we weren't crazy about the sink in the bathroom. Would have liked a counter.

review.title: Opal exceeded expectation!
review.reviewText:
Staff at the Opal Hotel were extremely pleasant and always willing to help. Angela and Ofelia (sp) went out of their way to get us settled in the room and make us feel welcome. They were great at suggesting things for us to do in the city. They went as far as to book a couple of our tours for our convenience.
As a side note, Mel's Drive-In is connected directly to this hotel by a door to the left of the check-in counter. Nice for avoiding the San Francisco panhandlers that apparently hang out on the corner outside. They seem harmless enough though.
In summary, we give it an A. We'd suggest this hotel to anyone looking to visit S.F.

review.title: THE OPAL, GOOD EXPERIENCE
review.reviewText: WE STAYED IN SAN FRANCISCO ONLY FOR 3 DAYS, THE WHOLE EXPERIENCE WAS GREAT STARTING WITH THE HOTEL WITH FRIENDLY STAFF AND GREAT RATES, GOOD LOCATION.

review.title: Definitely Will Go Back
review.reviewText:
Overall, my experience was great.

The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. They even went so far as to recommend some fantastic dining locations within walking distance.

The layout of the hotel floorplan took some getting used to. Definitely not a typical American hotel chain layout. It was a nice change (for a frequent traveller). It simply added to the overall experience of a wonderful stay in San Francisco!

review.title: Good for its price!
review.reviewText: The staff were very accomodating and helpful. Tours are easy to find as the hotel is 10 minutes walking distance from Union Square. It's also located near the Cultural District. Room was clean and house keeping responds quickly to any requests. I feel guilty we weren't able to leave them a tip. Overall, it's a good choice if you want to save on money and you just want to tour the city.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Tur. Bedroom is clean and with a good internet connection and tv channels. A little bit expensive.

review.title: Excellent deal, great location
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly, the room clean, the hotel was fairly cheap and had a great location. The rooms are celan, as well as the bathrooms. Breakfast service is very food considering that it was complimentary. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel Close to SF Performing Arts Center
review.reviewText: The location is perfect for people attending performances at the SF Performing Arts Center (War Memorial Opera House, Davies Symphony Hall) and the Asian Art Museum, or for any visit to Civic Center. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and my room was quiet and spotless.

review.title: Nice small hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My experience at this hotel was satisfactory. the location is good, the staff was friendly and helpful. Will consider staying here again.

review.title: opal san fransisco
review.reviewText: poor service.

review.title: Loved the hotel, location, people!
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel ... far enough away from the busy-ness of downtown yet very accessible by bus. Restaurants within walking distance. Just a great little find. We would definitely return!

review.title: opal hotel 0211
review.reviewText: was very satisfied with the Opal hotel. not only was everything as ordered, when our needs changed, unexpectedly, they were met with extreme efficiency during our stay.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: Satisfied

review.title: Charged $50 for leaving without checking out
review.reviewText: I called the front desk and asked if there was any kind of checkout policy, the lady said there wasn't any unless I wanted a receipt. They didn't refund me my $50 that they initially took for room service and what not.

review.title: Very charming and perfect for budget conscious
review.reviewText: They keep the front doors locked unless you have a room key, which I loved. Just an extra sense of security since the Tenderloin is a block away. The lobby was very cool....old school and vintage, yet nice. Our room was small, but had what we needed - comfy bed, tv and clean bathroom with hot shower. The only complaint I have is that they definitely need to update their bedding. The comforter we had looked like it had been there since the hotel opened back in 1908 and the blanket they provided was old and worn....there was even a hole in it just from wear and tear. Sheets were clean and soft and thankfully the heater in the room worked so I didn't have to deal with the nasty blanket & comforter. The continental breakfast was ok...a cereal option would have been nice. Basically, bread, bagels, hard-boiled eggs and two different types of fruit. It was free though so I guess I can't really complain. I would probably stay here again if we were on a budget, otherwise I'd rather spend the extra money to have nicer sleeping arrangements. A short walk to most public transportation and Polk St. is one block away which has a ton of fun restaurants and bars.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
TThe hotel was great.Only downfall was aprkink- they had their own parking lot - for a fee of course-It was not well-marked and we had an extremely difficult time finding it. The neighbourhood seemed cleaned- Not very close to any of the tourisists spots.
Satisfied with hotel-Parking lot needs to be marked clearly. Wuld stay there again.

review.title: Good but not great.
review.reviewText: Spent 4 nights, the rooms were nothing special but slept good on the comfortable bed. Continental breakfast was lacking. Not much there, basically just toast and bagels with juice coffee and tea, no yogurt or muffins or cereal, that we had at other continental breakfasts. Walls were a little thin but neighbors were quiet. Ice machine on our floor was broken. had to go down 2 floors. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful.

review.title: OPALesque
review.reviewText: I have stayed here before and enjoyed the location for cab accesibility, great food near by and a quaint, quiet location. We stayed in the junior suite, great spacious room. Quiet floor not facing the street.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The location is good but the customer service was not so good. The deposit needs $50 per night, per room which was not explained when I checked in and has never been asked by other hotels. I called them to get me explained about the misterious money withdrawl and they were a bit rude to me. And there were several homeless people around the hotel but did not feel dangerous. Anyway San Francisco is so great!

review.title: Perfect location to move around SF by public transportation
review.reviewText: Nice location, walkable to Union Square and easy to catch bus to other tourist spot. Although hotel has some coffee and bread for breakfast we prefer to sit in the restaurant at the corner for heavy breakfast, forgot the name of restaurant but it open from morning till late evening.

review.title: will always use in this side of the town
review.reviewText: there were tours buses there with guest. there were never in my way of checking in out on my visit. U are able to get buses to get to other areas in city.

review.title: Good value and location. Good for pets.
review.reviewText: When we travel, we often take our dog. This hotel didn't charge us a pet fee which means a great deal to us. Often times, we end up paying $150 just for our dog to stay in the room with us too. Anyways, location was really good too. Lot's of places to eat at in walking distance, and across the street from the cinema. Parking at this hotel fills up fast, but you can park at the cinema next door overnight and it is actually cheaper than parking at the hotel.

review.title: Very good stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very old, but well maintained. Nice character (and this coming from a 23 year old). It was much more interesting to look at that the boring Holiday Inns and Best Westerns. The hotel staff was helpful, printing documents for me for free rather than making me pay for it in the business center. The breakfast was alright, continental, but fresh. Awesome retro diner is connected to the lobby so you don't have to leave the building. Cabs were hard to get outside unless you call first. Great shower!

review.title: Nice surprise
review.reviewText: Small, clean hotel. Checked everywhere for bed bugs -- all clear. Not the best neighborhood right on the edge of the tenderloin, but I did not feel threatened and it's a convenient location. It was not super noisy but I turned on the fan anyway to drown out traffic sounds. Lovely man working the front desk at check in. Very friendly, minus the "California cool" attitude. Basic continental breakfast. There are HB eggs as well as peanut butter if you need protein in the a.m. Complimentaty wine and cheese at happy hour -- nice, exactly what I needed after a long trip.

review.title: Socks and flipflops
review.reviewText:
This was the dirtiest hotel room I've ever experienced. If I hadn't pre-paid for the room through an Expedia package we would have immediately checked out and gone somewhere else. The carpet and furniture were stained. The towels and sheets were thread bare. The windows looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a decade. Everything felt dirty. We wore flip flops to avoid touching the carpet and I felt compelled to use a sock to avoid touching the remote control. We tried to spend as little time in the room as possible. We walked down the street to get cocktails, hoping they would help distract us from the room.

I asked what the continental breakfast consisted of when we checked in. The man behind the counter said: "ham, eggs, onions, cheese". After seeing the room, we knew we didn't want to eat breakfast at the hotel, but my wife looked in on the breakfast as we were checking out. It was stacks of sh*tty bread next to a line of toasters with coffee and OJ. None of the foods that the concierge promised were there.

The hotel is well situated if you happen to need to go to the opera or the Spanish Consulate, otherwise you could do better... and should.

review.title: Location worked for us
review.reviewText: Others have noted that the Opal's location is inconvenient. This is correct if you want to be near Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf. We were in the city for the opera five blocks away, so the Opal worked well. And those commenting that Geary going east is a bit scruffy are correct, but we never found it at all threatening. The hotel is a bit worn but housekeeping is more than acceptable. Everything in the room worked as it should. Wired internet connection was not as fast as broadband but okay; local calls are free. The room off the lobby where breakfast is served was never uncomfortably crowded; the food was just okay, a convenience if you have to make an early start. Mel's Diner, off the lobby, provides a reasonably priced alternative.

review.title: Stylish hotel -loved the decor
review.reviewText: This was a good choice for the lower side of san fran. We wanted to visit the mission district. We had to take a bus to get south there or a bus to get north to the coast. In the center of the city. There were some homeless but not like the tenderloin district which is close. Avoid walking through there. People were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is packed so you can eat in the lobby area. Not alot of little kids here. People from all over world.

review.title: We will return!
review.reviewText: The Opal is a historic structure so do not expect all the modern luxuries. The hotel is nicely restored and well kept. The common areas are very pleasant and comfortable. As for the front desk, by and large they are a great group of people. This was our fourth stay at the Opal and at only one time were we moderately disappointed with a clerk's attitude. The rooms, though tiny, are comfortable and provide a sufficient amount of space to get around. After all if you are going to spend vacation time or even business time stuck in your hotel room you are wasting valuable time in a very wonderful city. The breakfast provided is plentiful and quite good. On future journeys to the far northwest corner of California we will most likely stay at the Opal again.

review.title: Unmatched customer service
review.reviewText: Great old hotel in the theater district. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and as described.

review.title: good deal for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideal for us, as we were going to a concert nearby. It wasn't really a "family" neighborhood, but overall, was a very good deal for how affordable it was. My only complaint was that we had to park down the street at an expensive parking garage. But the staff was very nice.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL!!!
review.reviewText: It was great!!! The hotel is great located, the room was very clean and spacious. Imagine that we requested 2 baby cribs and they both fit togheter one next to the other and we have extra room to walk. The staff was very kind and gentle. The only bad thing is that you need to pay extra for the parking. But all the rest is perfect!!!

review.title: Best hotel I have stayed in last six years
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the OPAL, San Francisco. The room was clean and always arranged neatly when I returned for the day. The breakfast in the morning was great to start the day. I liked the laundry machine which is conveniently inside the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located at Geary/Van Ness making it easy to catch MUNI buses. The hotel staff were quite friendly and cooperative. I plan to visit again.

review.title: Prime Place
review.reviewText: The Opal - San Francisco was a nice stay. There were no flags and/or whistles. The hotel is quite historic, and very quaint. The continental breakfast was okay. The breakfast room could of used a bit more additional counters to serve the food, and thereby accommodate the crowd better. We really enjoyed the central location of The Opal - we were able to walk to Union Square, and catch a trolley to Fisherman's Wharf, and then catch a city bus back to The Opal.

review.title: Great for shows at GAMH
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff with friendly attitudes.

review.title: Good old hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location

review.title: The Opal
review.reviewText: The Opal was a nice hotel, very clean with a room that was a bit small, but comfortable. The location wasn't what I expected but I felt safe at all times and public transportation was easily accessible.

review.title: Stay Away!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very old and leaves a smell on your clothes, breakfast is a joke and you only get cheerios, raisin bran, bagels and toast, no eggs, no bacon and it is like this daily. This staff is rude, pay extra and go elsewhere.

review.title: Great quaint hotel
review.reviewText: The Opal is a great old hotel in a pretty convienient, though sometimes shady part of town. The rooms are very cute and comfortable and they offer a continental, though a little basic breakfast. It is definitely worth a visit especially as its cost.

review.title: Convenient location, but rude staff and sketchy neighbourhood
review.reviewText:
We were in SF for a weekend event and selected this hotel because it was very close to the venue hosting the event. When we arrived the desk staff were very rude, ignoring us to help other guests when we tried to check in despite our being next in line, taking phone calls in the middle of the check in process, and even jamming my license in a crack in the desk and folding it back and forth while chatting on the phone, then getting huffy when I asked her to please not break my ID.
When we got up to the room it was a decent size, and relatively comfortable, but the shower curtains were mildewed, and the toilet had a tendency to run. The "continental breakfast" offered in the morning was white toast and coffee or tea, and the elevator from the parking lot wasn't working the first day we were there.
There was a bus stop just outside which made it easy to get to the piers and other tourist attractions, but there was also a place across the street billing it's self as "the Carnegie Hall of Public S*x" and the whole neighbourhood was a bit sketchy after dark.
For the money you can probably do better.

review.title: A hotel with a Great Location!
review.reviewText: A very convenient place to stay when I visit my son in S.F., due to the immediate proximity of the MUNI and BART transportation systems. I have stayed there many times when I visit him in S.F. Clean, reasonable, and comfortable.

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText: They didn't provide enough toiletries, the bed was uncomfortable, the tv was broken, the hairdryer smelled smoky, the pillows were rock hard, the toilet broke, the hotel clerk gave us faulty directions, the surrounding neighborhood is a little seedy, the rooms need a serious remodeling, and I think the atmosphere is just a little spooky. Also woken up at 4:30 am by noisy guests. I guess the price was ok.... Also they have a hefty damage deposit. Love San Francisco, I don't love this hotel.

review.title: I'll stay here again
review.reviewText: Room was spacious, wifi worked great, staff was terrific. It's an older building but in good shape. The only downside was the location. It's a little bit of a trip from Downtown. I walked through some so-so neighborhoods because I really couldn't figure out the buses. It's a six dollar cab ride from the Powell Street BART station. All-in-all I was very happy and would stay here again.

review.title: Would stay here again!
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was great - the bus (which will take you to all of the popular places) had stops very near the hotel, and the hotel is within walking distance to Japantown, many restaurants, and shops. The Opal is located on a busy street, but the traffic noise was not noticeable from our room. Our room was very clean and the staff was friendly and helped us navigate the town. The Opal has a gated parking area for guests, which we were thankful for, and the charge for parking was a bit lower than many of the other hotels. Overall, we would stay at this simple, convenient hotel again - it's a good value!

review.title: Very Nice place to stay in SF
review.reviewText:
I stayed here together with my wife for 3 nights at the end of October. Perfectly located as it is close to all major public transport, close to the city center and you can find all you need (coffeebar, restaurants, supermarkets) in the direct neighbourhood.
We had a big room, with a a good bathroom. Windows have an inside and outside part and isolate the outside noise very well. Room is well equiped with a nice TV, coffee and tea pot, ironing facilities.
Breakfast is basic, but sufficient for a quick start of the day (breakfast ends at 09.00 am!). We would certainly go back here next time!

review.title: Great place in San Francisco
review.reviewText: While the locked front door may be off-putting to some, it sends a signal that this place is secure--so any tourist, male or female will feel safe. The public spaces are clean and well kept, and the staff, especially at the front desk are friendly and welcoming. They also are willing to take the time and answer any questions, or provide suggestions on how to get around the city. My room was clean, bright and in good condition. Free internet connections are available (for those with PCs) in your room; and there is a pay-to-use computer in the "breakfast room." The continental breakfast was fresh and appetizing, and enjoyable, and the young lady working there was friendly and welcoming. Easy access to city buses and other transportation--or for a walk around the city. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

review.title: Peace, comfort and service
review.reviewText:
From the attractive and spacious lobby to the courteous and helpful staff, every thing associated with my stay was pleasant. The large well maintained room provided all the comforts needed to relax after a 12 hour day of conferences and meetings.

I would definitely stay again for both business and pleasure.

review.title: Horrible Customer Service
review.reviewText: My wife and I booked this hotel for a trip to the city to see Wicked on her birthday. Reviews of the hotel stated that it was close to everything. However, it should have said was that it was in the middle of everything, but close to nothing. The neighborhood is dicey and the sounds of sirens are frequent. However, that wouldn't have been a problem if it weren't for the way we were treated by the front desk staff when we later had a problem with our room. On Saturday we headed out into the city to see the sights and returned late in the afternoon to find that our room hadn't been changed over. We approached the front desk about our situation and were told it MUST have had a 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door. (I am not a fan of those in customer service who insist on suggesting that any problem you may have with their service is entirely your own fault). I assured him that this was not the case and he assured me that he would take care of the problem. When we returned later from dinner our room was still unchanged. Furthermore, when I asked the front desk clerk for towels so that we could at least take a shower with fresh towels before seeing the show, the man at the desk became rude and said that he would take care of it. We never did receive our towels. I have read that the staff at this hotel is courteous and helpful, however, if you stay there just pray that everything goes smoothly, or you may find the front desk staff rudely blaming the whole thing on you.

review.title: The Hotel has met my needs.
review.reviewText: As I went to a business travel the Hotel met my needs.It is located in a excellent place with easy access to the downtown and near San Francisco"s sightseeings.As I was out all day, I used it only for breakfast and sleep.The breakfast and accommodations are good.The Hotel is nice and well kept.I"ll come back again.

review.title: good place
review.reviewText: The room was very clean. It was nearby most tourist attractions like China Town and Crooked Street. My only gripe is that there was no refridgerator in my room! Perhaps they would have given me one if I had asked. The price was very fair for the summer time. Its not the most luxurious but it served its purpose. The staff was very helpful which I appreciated.

review.title: I would stay there again.
review.reviewText: It is a very convenient hotel to a lot in San Francisco. It is recently updated. The service and continental breakfast were very good. We would certainly stay there again if we go back.

review.title: Enjoyed the hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. The room was fairly large by San Francisco standards. The bathroom was huge. The hotel staff was knowlegable and helpful. Breakfast was good, although always very busy and not a lot of choices. Easy 10 block walk to BART and Muni, although buses to several sites go right by the door. I bought a muni visitor pass. I plan on staying here again. Great bargain.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: As was said in other reviews, the breakfast room is not large enough for all guests, but don't let that put you off. The quality of the room was above average and everything was perfectly clean and taken care of. The beggars in the neighbourhood of the hotel which other reviews warned for, weren't a problem, even not at night. We did both breakfast and takeaways from Mel's Diner (next door) and these were great to - actually a good though more expensive replacement for the breakfast in the hotel. The 'center' is a 15-minute walk away but its location also allows you to get quickly to the West-side of town (Japan town, Alamo square, park) as well as to Civic center which is only 5 minutes away. Great value for money, very satisfying.

review.title: Solid Choice
review.reviewText: Nothing to complain about. Good location, right next to AMC movie theatre.

review.title: Enjoyed It!
review.reviewText: My wife and i had a king bed that was very comfortable. Our room was a few floors up street side the double pane (sp) windows cut out all of the street noise. Bathroom was clean. People at the front desk are helpful with directions and public transportation schedules. Great place.

review.title: Gem Of San Fran
review.reviewText: Small, quozy, classic hotel close to union sqaure. I would stay there again. Helpful and friendly staff. I would not recomand eating next door at mel's dine it. The food was ok, nothing amazing, especially for the price. Look around, you will find great SF for better prices. Perfect hotel for families or young travelers!

review.title: Clean/ Inexpensive Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice clean room... I would recomend this hotel if you are looking for a clean inexpensive place to stay, and are willing to forgo extra items such as spa services, room service, swimming pool, or hot tub.

review.title: Very impressed.
review.reviewText: Excellent place to stay.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: For those travelers that plan to spend the majority of their time sightseeing then this hotel is for you. It's right in the center of the city, on a major highway (bus route), is inexpensive when purchased in a package, and clean and cozy enough to sleep in. However, the walls are very thin and depending on your "neighbors" you may be interrupted during the night, this only happened once during our stay. Also don't depend on the continental breakfast if you expect a variety of items. Apples were the only fruit available and the "orange juice" tasted like Sunny D. Go to the restaurant attached to the hotel - very delicious!

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: good location feel as a boutique hotel, with Victorian age theme, you sleep in a movie form the 18th century! very clean very home feeling very warm feeling good PPV price per value will recommend to anyone, even to my psychic cleaner mother, to stay in this hotel. Breakfast can be eaten outside since the breakfast there is serials and bagel with jam.

review.title: Great location - handy bus service.
review.reviewText: I brought my college daughter and her best friend for a "girls shopping outing", and this hotel was great. It was clean and comfortable and the location worked out well. You could eat next door at Mel's Diner (good food and reasonable) or catch a bus right outside the door to either downtown shopping (about 8 blocks) or to Fisherman's Wharf (about a mile). The only negative that I would even mention is that the breakfast room was really small and got very crowded, so it was hard to get food. Also they had the exact same thing evry day and we were there for 4 daysso it got tiring. A little more variety would be nice. We would definately stay the again, especially for the great price and location.

review.title: A great little hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was much better than I expected. All the staff were very friendly and I would definitely stay there again. A real gem!

review.title: Great Price -- Great Place to stay
review.reviewText: This is Victorian cutey hotel has large charming rooms. The staff is very friendly and the lobby is lovely. No mini bar so take your own snacks and beverages. They were very gracious in providing a cork screw for our wine. At these prices you can afford to have breakfast next door at Mel's. It was nice to have safe, hassle free parking. Yes you have to pay $28 extra, but folks this is San Francisco ... that's the norm. We asked for 2 non smoking rooms, and called ahead to make sure that we had them. That was a good idea since we booked on line and it's always good to confirm ahead of time before people get stressed at check in. As it was a tour bus of foreign visitors were checking in just ahead of us, and there were only 3 rooms left in the hotel.

review.title: it was....ok
review.reviewText: I chose my hotel based strictly on previous reviews from customers versus the star rating given to it by the website, but they must have had the luxury of staying in the main part of the hotel, whereas our room was located in a separate building which seemed to have been an apartment complex that was purchased by the hotel at some point in the past and was only accessable by going through about 4 hallways, 5 doors, 1 elevator and you were required to go outside 2 times during the travel from the lobby to the actual room. It took us quite a few tries to master the art of being able to find our room (no one at the front desk even offered to assist us and had to know how difficult it was to locate). The bed made a really funny noise when you sat anywhere near the bottom right side of it and the thing had to be older than me-i could feel every spring when laying down. Our peep hole had a kleenex stuffed into it because it was apparenlty missing the glass and the hotel needed to plug up the hole so you couldn't see in from the outside. The location was excellent and the staff was pretty friendly. I really liked that they allowed your pet to stay with you at no extra charge. Other than that I probably won't stay here again.

review.title: Good location????
review.reviewText: I chose the hotel because the reviews mentioned about its location. However, though it was about equally distant from all the sightseeing places, more than 20 minutes walk from everywhere is way too far to say it's a good location.

review.title: A find in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The neighborhood leaves something to be desired but for the price, you can't beat it.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: Great place to stay at. Located on Van Ness near everything, couple blocks from Union Square, next door to great eateries. Definitely recommended, great price

review.title: Grand old hotel
review.reviewText: What a hidden gem of a hotel. It would have been perfect, except the king mattress was old and sagged in the middle.

review.title: Cheap and convenient but not much else
review.reviewText: My wife and I were looking for a place to stay that was located near her doctors office. The Opal was not even 500 yards from it so we made it our spot for the night. The carpets were being torn up and that may have also been affecting the elevators. Because, on more then one occasion I had to either use the second elevator or the stairs due to the elevator being down for service. The bedrooms seemed clean and a reasonable size although the free internet was painfully slow. I am also glad I brought my own pillows because the supplied ones were very stiff. I was probably most disappointed with the continental breakfast. I am a diabetic and I have seen from time to time hotels give away something with a little protein. But The Opal was a carb fest muffins, pancakes, english muffins and dry cereal. I mean for a free breakfast I guess it would be fine for someone who didn't need to watch what they ate. Overall I wasn't impressed. I would probably stay here again if it was another trip to the doctors offices. But I am sure that if I had traveled across the country to enjoy the sites and sounds of San Fran then I would have found a hotel that made me enjoy going back to my room as well.

review.title: A little gem
review.reviewText: Centrally located in SF and very comfortable. Will be staying there again.

review.title: Great place would probably go back.
review.reviewText: One problem was we only got one soap and did not get another one the second day or clean glasses! The couple who came with us had coffee and the pot was not cleaned or the cups replaced the next day; neither was their coffee replenished. Other than that, service was great.

review.title: Excellent Location, great value
review.reviewText: The hotel is located really nearby many of the attractions. My friends and I actually walked back from Fisherman's Wharf to this hotel in about 20 minutes, it is also a very enjoyable walk as you can take detours through chinatown or to market street. I think we also passed the financial district. Continental breakfast is juice cereal bread and apples, but itll keep you full until the real good san francisco food. Great place to stay.

review.title: Very reasonable
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel - the rooms were well equipped, clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were also very helpful and friendly. Mels Diner which is located next door is very convenient and provides good breakfasts. The only downsides were the fact that our room was located near an elevator which 'pinged' all night and the breakfast provided by the hotel is poor.

review.title: The Opal is a real gem
review.reviewText: I was thrilled with this adorable hotel! The location is very convenient. Our king-size room was huge, and the continental breakfast is a nice bonus. The room rate was an absolute steal, and for the quality I would've expected to pay double. The only change I'd like to see is being offered the continental breakfast beyond 9am. We would definitely stay at the Opal again.

review.title: Very nice and polite staff
review.reviewText: It is a good location around Civic center. Very comfortable room and bed, except the TV needs to upgrade to the modern style to fit the room better. Only some noise from the hallway disturbed us a little. Overall, it was a wonderful stay.

review.title: NIce Hotel, nice location...
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but the front desk forgot to tell me they charge $28 or so to park in their garage, which may be standard in San Francisco, but a surprise charge at the end of your stay is not fun. They did comply and waved the fee because I wasn't informed prior to check-in, but the parking charge is something everyone should know about up front.

review.title: one of the Best Hotels in SF
review.reviewText: its location and attractive price are enough to be called one of the best hotels for different travelers(either business or leisure),the service is good, breakfast is also impressive, anyway, it's a good stay for travelers, especially for family tour.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Convenience to places of interest. Close to public transportation and good restaurants. Lok forward to returning soon.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: I completely recommend the Opal to anyone. It was located at a convenient location. We enjoyed staying in our room. We had excellent water pressure and the bed was comfy. The continental breakfast was OK, but was enough to hold us over until lunch time. The rates were reasonable. Overall we were happy and will return for another stay.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: This is the best deal you can find on the Net in SF. Great location and very comfortable room. Includes breakfast and exercise room. Parking is extra. Easiest parking is across the street in Cathedral Hill lot. Opal will validate, making it $20 per night with in-and-out.

review.title: The Opal -- San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean, well restored and managed hotel in the middle of it all on main thoroughfare running north/south to Wharf (Hwy 101).

review.title: Good value for mony
review.reviewText: nice price, nice location,nice hotel.

review.title: Loved the Wednesday night wine and cheese tasting!!!!!
review.reviewText: A comfortable very clean hotel. The lobby carpet should be updated and they should have a larger breakfast room. Other than that, staff were very accomodating and helpful. We had a back room, so city noise was not a problem. Good location.

review.title: Comfortable, reasonably priced hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite conveniently located, with a bus-stop near the door, and Japantown & cable car stop in walking distance. Room was comfortable and quiet. Buffet breakfast basic but adequate.

review.title: Its OK
review.reviewText: Men at the front desk are rude. Maids are friendly. Coffee is good. Room is pretty clean. Beds aren't comfortable and the shampoo leaves your hair very frizzy. Also bring your own conditioner because there isn't any in the room.

review.title: I would class this as a budget type hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, but noisy, especially with windows open. Carpets in reception were well worn and really need replacing (there was a piece of tape running right across part of the carpet). Hotel needs an overall uplift, as it is quite old fashioned. It was our first hotel in SF, so we didn't know what to expect. Breakfast facilities were abysmal. The room was too small for the amount of guests having breakfast. Guests had to spill out into reception to eat and a couple of mornings, we did not even get a table! Breakfast was not brilliant and needed much more choice. There was NO brown bread, only white, which we don't like! When I asked about this, I was told, brown bread wasn't provided! We loved our King bed! Photo shown of restaurant, was actually next door, but no discount was given for hotel guests! We didn't have tea/coffee making facilities in our room; this was provided in reception and was ok. Still enjoyed our stay!

review.title: Comfortable inexpensive central hotel
review.reviewText: Central in the city on Van Ness ave, which means that it is not close to the touristic sites (Market street shopping, Fishermans Wharf, Golden Gate area, Chinatown) but not far from any of them either. We walked from the hotel to a different area every day. Good, friendly service and acceptable pricing. Complimentary breakfast is no banquet but suffices, although they close the buffet quite early (at 9.00). Overall we had a very nice stay.

review.title: Everything was okay .
review.reviewText: Overall the best thing about the hotel was the the charm (not the best hotel I've stayed in) which in San Fran I was happy with - also happy with location (but not at night - cabs though are frequent).

review.title: worth to recommend
review.reviewText: good service and comfortable hotel

review.title: Do not stay in this hotel!
review.reviewText: The experience was, by far, very disappointing. The internet service in the room never worked, the support number never got answered, I had to take a cold shower the first day, after fixing the problem the shower dripped water constantly, the room was next to some kind of equipment that make noise the entire night, the shower mat was disgustingly dirty (I have pictures) and, to complete the episode, velcro strips and nail clippers were missing from my room. Do not stay here. Management is completely unresponsive to guests requests.

review.title: fancy hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed in three different hotels in different areas and my children and I thought this was a "fancy hotel". The lounge was very nice. I felt better knowing we had parked in a secure garage, even though it was twenty something to park there and the beds were comfertable. The breakfast could have been better, and the toilet would not flush after someone had all ready used it. But over all it was very nice.

review.title: Very good indeed
review.reviewText: Great location. Good value.

review.title: heard it was great and was
review.reviewText: Spent 3 nights their,staff was great and hotel was quiet in a busy city.There is a great thai restaraunt off ofarell, wasnt to inpressed w Mels Will look them up agian when im in town next year.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I was a little concerned about the references I had found online about bed bugs. But once we arrived I found the hotel room very clean. The hotel building is older but in good condition. We switched rooms half way through our visit and I liked the second room best. It was on the top floor and very spacious with a good view. The breakfast was good and wifi was free. Very close to public transportation. Rather close to a sketchy area of town but I never felt unsafe.

review.title: Opal to the rescue
review.reviewText: Origionally stayed at the Powell hotel. Was so unimpressed. Switched hotels to the Opal. It was like night and day. Nice clean rooms, comfy beds, centrally located. I can not say enought good things about them.

review.title: The Smallest Room
review.reviewText: Its the first hotel that we have stayed in that couldn't get us in before check in time and had very limited access to luggage before our flight. Staff seemed very overwhelmed.

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: great hotel value in a city notorious for high hotel rates! the opal is conveniently located and has the feel of a european boutique hotel (could use a few simple upgrades to secure that status, i.e. fresh flowers, upgrades to the breakfast). the hotel has no parking facilities but street parking is available in all directions, both metered and free. we did not have a chance to try mel's next door but there are plenty of other options within easy walking distance. a convenient walk will take you through the architectural beauty of the civic center area. note to hotel: the air conditioning system is confusing to operate and not very effective...it's a good thing the heat wave of june cooled off by the time we left. i would stay here again!

review.title: Will not stay here again
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was not as efficient and friendly as they could be. The room was damp and smells a little. Wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling. The fee for garage parking at the hotel is very reasonable compare to other hotels but accessing the garage is a little tricky and cumbersome. To walk into the garage from the outside you have to ring the front desk from an intercom for them to open the gate, and the sign for getting back to the lobby was not clear. Overall the hotel is clean, and the free internet and breakfast are nice bonus, but would definitely pay more to stay at the other hotels.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: The Opal hotel and staff were extremely helpful. I was a little disappointed with the continental breakfast but overall a great place to stay.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: I was pleasnatly surprised when I arrived at the Opal. This is an older hotel but is very well maintained. My room was clean and confortable.

review.title: A bit out of the way
review.reviewText: We enjoyed The Opal, as a hotel. The breakfast was good and it was fun to be surrounded by all those French tourists. But ultimately, we decided that next time we will stay somewhere more central, closer to Union Square or Market Street. We like being in the midst of all the activity and to be able to go out and cruise the galleries, shops, etc.

review.title: The Opal
review.reviewText: What old charm this hotel has.....It's located in a great section of town. Classy place. Clean & comfortable, friendly staff, beds were great,and that is rare at hotels, sheets were extra great. Water pressure isn't that good and the drainage in the shower not so good. Someone needs to clean the drain trap or something. I hate standing in water while showering. The restaurant next door, Mel's Drive In, is amazing. Very diverse menu, and the food is great. And they are open until 4:00 A.M.!!! Very classy hotel, and I would definately return in the future!!!

review.title: Better than I expected
review.reviewText: The Opal was a good hotel. I was a little worried because I had a bad experience with another hotel I found, but the Opal was great. The only thing was that I saw toe nail clippings on the floor. I guess the vacuum cleaner didn't pick them up. The room was pretty quiet considering it faced the street. But, you can hear people's doors close. All in all, good hotel and would recommend it.

review.title: Nice hotel for a weekend stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, the rooms were also very clean but small. Nice hotel for an overnight or weekend stay if you don't want to spend too much.

review.title: Nice but wouldn't go back
review.reviewText: It was a nice place but we arrived around 7pm there was no more parking we had to park across the street @ another hotels parking lot. Keys were weird I never got the bottles of water that were suppose to come with the room. The hallway smelled like smoke when we were leaving. Not the good smoke either.

review.title: Would recommend as a basic hotel
review.reviewText: I would go back to this hotel. It's nothing amazing but is ideal if all you need is a base to explore the city. The facilites and comfort compares to a Travel Lodge in the UK. It's quite old but everything worked and was clean. It's at Van Ness and Geary so you can walk to the Civic Center and Union Square, the bus stop is right outside and the cable car is about 5 mins walk. The inclusive breakfast was ample (bagels, cereal, danish etc) and the staff were helpful. The rooms have a tiny hairdryer, cable TV and alarm clock and safety deposit boxes are available at reception. The diner attached does nice food in massive portions and the staff are really friendly.

review.title: European Hotel at affordable prices
review.reviewText: Great location, excellent service, beautifully decorated rooms.

review.title: great little hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Opal. It has a great location, a few blocks from the top of the California cable car line. We were in the 'quiet zone', off Van Ness. Overall great homebase. One tiny annoyance; we arrived very thirsty but nothing but tap water available in the hotel itself. Big pluses - high ceilings, lovely Victorian decor, and friendly, helpful staff.

review.title: The Opal Hotel's Prime Location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located near San Francisco's City Hall and Civic Center. It is easily accessible to the Freeways and Golden Gate Bridge. The major Tourist attractions are also easily accessible. The hotel's staff is very professional and very helpful. In summation,I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: It was memorable. I feel the need for a careful watch over the building. It's almost a landmark.
review.reviewText: After the desk clerk and I disagreed as to the room I reserved. I reserved through Expedia and requested a room on top floor (5th) and tub."Not all the rooms have tubs. You have to remember the structure of the building, some of the rooms still have the fixtures of when it was first a hotel". The older desk clerk told her to put me in the 5th floor. The stay was comfortable. I slept. The continetal breakfast is filling. Great assortment. Nicely presented. Had a good time.

review.title: Great Bargain
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel for the incredible low price that I paid. The room was large and nicely decorated. Despite being on a major street the double paned windows kept out the noise. My only complaints are, the bathroom lighting was too dim, I had to run the water for awhile to get hot water and the heater seemed to be set at a certain temperature which was too cold for me and I could not get it to go higher. Otherwise, a great bargain, a good area and very convenient for everything I was doing.

review.title: A Convenient Place and ...
review.reviewText: Features: This hotel is located nearby downtown so it is very convenient to find restaurants and other stores. The lobby also feels comfortable and the hotel maintains a standard cleanliness and conditions. Breakfast is included. Internet is provided. Not usual wireless internet, but high speed cable speed and free. A really plus! One of the receptionists is very helpful Other Things & Trivial matters: - Opal Hotel charges a fee for parking. It is not reasonable but i was not well informed about it. - One of the receptionists does not serve guests well. No clarity in explanation and no smily face. - Water in the bathtub is warm, not hot. - (Smoking Room) Noise occurs at around 00:00 am & 6:00 ~ 7:00 am in the morning. Perhaps, I am sensitive to sound that makes me notice these things. It is the sound of heavy wheel reeling, door slamming, and something thrown on the ground. Overall: If you're aiming for downtown, this hotel may best fit you. But subjectively, not for me.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was very friendlyand helpful in anything we needed. The continental breakfast was very satisfying and everyone was friendly.

review.title: Much better than we expected
review.reviewText: The Opal Hotel was really great - the staff was very friendly and helpful and free continental breakfast is offered (it's hard to find great hospitality like that these days). The location is great - very close to everything and the MUNI (bus) system makes it very easy to get to anywhere you wish. There's a bus stop right outside the hotel. The room was nice, clean, and comfy. I'd definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: A very good location and a good choice of a hotel if you are on a budget trip!

review.title: very helpful
review.reviewText: Staff were helpful,breakfast was more than adequate to set you off for the day,

review.title: Convienent location and affordable
review.reviewText: The Opal is affordable and convienently located as there are two 24 hour bus lines practically at your doorstep. You can not beat the price and the staff were nice and helpful. We also enjoyed Mel's diner in the Hotel and Tommy's Joynt Bar across the street. All perfect for a budget traveler.

review.title: Not bad, but...
review.reviewText: Pretty so-so. They did upgrade my room, however.

review.title: My favorite city
review.reviewText: parking fees are excessive for this location. $25 daily, plus tax. The room was small and cramped. Just a single dining room type chair to sit on, other than the side of the bed

review.title: Small but clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms were a little small but very comfortable and very clean and ECONOMICAL. It was very close to the downtown shopping area and not too far from the Fisherman's Wharf. There was a complimentary breakfast every morning and although there was no restaurant in the hotel there was a diner connected to the hotel which was quite nice...especially the milkshakes!!

review.title: Good Hotel but not in central tourist area
review.reviewText: Hotel exceeded expectations. Reception staff very helpful but be prepared for a crush at breakfast as the breakfast room is small. Although it is on the edge of the less desirable Tenderloin area of the city, bus stops are close by for journeys into the city and all the well known tourist attractions.

review.title: Would definitely return
review.reviewText: We read many reviews of this hotel prior to booking. I am glad we did not pay attention to the bad ones. For the price and location, we could not have asked for anything better. No car, so parking was not a problem. The hotel may be somewhat outdated, but the room was very clean and comfortable. The staff friendly and informative. The morning complimentary breakfast was more than enough to get you going on your way for a day of sightseeing. Two satisfied travelers on this one.

review.title: Decent Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a perfect location. I was attending a conference in downtown SFO and the hotel was just perfect for that. All tourist attractions are also located withing a very close proximity. The hotel is a short walk away from the BART station too.

review.title: Great deal in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my stay at the Opal. It is very clean and the staff are very competent. If I needed service, it was taken care of immediately. I was also very happy to see Mel's Diner connected to the hotel. Another big plus was the internet connection in my room. It was fast and allowed me to keep up with my business. In room coffee, as well as the continental breakfast , made the mornings convenient, fast and save me $$. I will stay there again when I visit San Francisco. My Hotel, air flight was a perfect combination.

review.title: Hotel with a lot of character!
review.reviewText: My husband and i loved this hotel. I was a little nervous because of the mixed reviews, but I don't know what anyone could complain about really. The staff was the best. Always pleasant and so very helpful. The room was spotless. It was small, but we were really only interested in sleeping in the room. The beds were comfortable, although I don't really care for feather pillows, and we had 8 of them! The shower pressure was good (which means a lot to me because I have a lot of hair!). The area was good, and we felt perfectly safe. The bus stop was right outside the door too. The complimentary breakfast...was what it is, continental - muffins, toast, fruit, etc. We were on the street side of the hotel, but on the 5th floor, so it was very quiet. We loved the city, and we loved the hotel. We can't wait to go back.

review.title: Best value for money
review.reviewText: Hotel is very good, service was excellent, front desk helped a lot, nice room and not so expensive. The only down side is the area that is between the hotel and union square, which is not the best. The hotel's environment is good, but there are some worse streets a couple of minutes from there. Still very recommended!!!

review.title: Great value- would likely stay here again
review.reviewText: The Opal is a great value while vacationing in SF! It is cheaper in price being that it is not right near the Fisherman's Wharf area, but you can easily take the #47 bus (stop is right outside the hotel) or walk about 8 blocks to catch one of the Cable Cars. You can park across the street at Cathedral Hill Hotel's garage for $20/night. While the hotel is somewhat old, the rooms are very nice and clean. The continental breakfast provides a good, but light, start to the day. Front desk staff was very friendly.

review.title: Must take advantage of this great deal!!
review.reviewText: Great location; its at walking distance from major attractions, also has a bus stop next to the main door, and its clean and safe; Besides, the breakfast its good. Has WiFi in the lobby.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Very nice employee, clean rooms and good area atound

review.title: You get what you paid for
review.reviewText: It is in an OK location, the cost for the parking is $25 a day plus tax and it is a hassle to get in. You have to get out of the car, press a button and scream the number of your parking space for them to open the gate for you. There are unsavory characters hanging around the gate, so be careful when you get in at night. The A/C was noisy, the carpet need to be replaced, and the room was way too small.

review.title: it was ok
review.reviewText: Hotel was older than I suspected. It was clean but did smell kind of musty. It was very clean. The Bathroom and sheets were very clean. It was a little off the path but they gave me directions to everything

review.title: Nice hotel in a crappy neighborhood
review.reviewText: The Opal is a nice place to stay with a very friendly staff. However, it is in the Tenderloin, which isn't the greatest part of SF. And the rooms are rather small, since it is an older hotel. If you don't mind walking a while to see nicer parts of the city, this is a good value. But if you'd rather avoid some of the grunge of the Tenderloin, choose another spot.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location for bus line and 5 blocks from California St. cable car line. Very friendly staff.

review.title: Affordable, but BAD location
review.reviewText: Great hotel if you're looking to save a few bucks. But as we were walking anywhere around the hotel, we felt very 'dirty' (alot of homeless people in this particular area). There are not alot of attractions nearby and the restaurants that are in walking distance were nothing special. I would recommend this to young people that want to save money and can handle walking around. If you're going to San Francisco to relax....don't stay here!

review.title: Good location and price
review.reviewText: The Opal is old, but its good for the price. Great location between Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: This is the second time we stayed here and I'm very satisfied. Good price compared to other hotels, very convenient location, and really good service. When you walk in, you get the impression that it's old and some of the carpet on the corridors is a bit old, but the rooms are great and clean. Perhpas the only disadvantage is that you have to park across the street because their parking is ALWAYS full. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nothing make me want to break dance, I might go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very nice location if you are going to be using San Francisco's excellent public transportation system. It is within walking distance to a number of excellent restaurants and the ubiquitous fast food chains (I am familiar due to the fact that I used to work right across the street). The hotel used to be one of San Francisco's nicest, but now it is a bit older and has gone through three different name changes in the last five years. The continental breakfast was great, the room was clean but my view totally sucked because there was a pigeon's nest right outside my window (complete with the pigeon in it). I might go back if they lower the price.

review.title: good place
review.reviewText: We went for honeymoon, and was very good experience, greate hotel, continental breakfast good.

review.title: Could have Been Great Except for One Problem
review.reviewText: We loved our room and the hotel. The available parking was perfect. A few counters were scratched and cracked but overall excellent EXCEPT the hot water was never "real" hot. You had to run it for 20 minutes to get it even warm and it never was hot. This really was frustruating and made staying here a pain.

review.title: San Francisco Hidden Jewel
review.reviewText: If you want to explore one of the world's great cities, the Opal San Francisco is the hotel to do it from. It is reasonably priced; it is small and easy to navigate through (short elevator rides, short halls to walk down); the desk clerks are helpful; the complementary breakfast is simple but enough to get you going on the day's adventures; but most important is it's location. You can easily get a bus directly to Union Square (shopping, theatres, cable cars and the Financial District), or to Davies Symphony Hall (San Francisco Symphony), or to AT&T Park (San Francisco Giants), or Fisherman's Wharf, or to a leisurely hike across the Golden Gate Bridge, or to Cliff House. Tommy's Joynt across the street has the best food in town in an earthy, bar/cafeteria, setting; very reasonably priced! Have fun.

review.title: Nice old hotel
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel kept in good condition. The location is pretty central. I got a giant room for a great price. Staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Opal Hotel
