review.reviewText: I like this hotel, Even though it is old it is clean and the staff were very friendly. It is good deal for the money.

review.title: Tourist Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a basic tourist hotel. Provides the needs of those who only use the hotel as a base in which to sleep and little else. If you want a hotel experience, meals, lounges, pool etc this is not the hotel for you. Staff good, any faults with room fixed very quickly. I was satisfied. it met my need.

review.title: OK, for the price
review.reviewText: For the price of the hotel, I couldn't expect much more. It was what it was. Rooms were decent sized but the decorations were very old which made the hotel seem dingy. Don't expect much from the breakfast either.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: I got a great rate for this hotel - it was very clean and comfortable and in a great location.

review.title: Good value/quality balance
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well located, close to MUNI lines so I did not need to rent a car to spend 3 fantastic days in San Francisco. Continental breakfast was included and was ok, my only issue was the room as it was packed of people so finding an open spot was difficult. There are good places open 24 hours for breakfast/dinner which is a plus. Room was adequate in size and might need some renewal (matress and carpet). Free internet access is a plus as I recently paid 12.95 a day in a different hotel. We just had an issue with the management of the hotel as I believe they poorly managed a situation they had with a group of teenagers that stayed at the hotel during their Prom night, they were drunk and oput of control so the police needed to intervene (took very long) so it made it a very long night for the rest of the guest. But all in all, I would recommend it.

review.title: A Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: I have to say this is the quietest hotel in San Francisco that I have ever stayed in. The room was nicely renovated and decorated, and very comfortable. With a nice sitting area, it was also very spacious. Breakfast was skimpy and disappointing, but the room itself was an outstanding bargain. I would definitely recommend it to a friend!

review.title: Excellent Value and worth a visit
review.reviewText: Yes, I know the aircon makes a noise, (mine does in Vegas), the bathrooms are 'compact' and I know it is on the edge of the Tenderloin area, but the excellent and polite staff, comfortable and clean rooms, excellent transit routes, complmentary breakfast MORE than make up for it.

review.title: great value for money
review.reviewText: very clean and well run hotel. Good breakfast to start the day-selection of cereals, muffins, bagels,buns, apples,orange juice, tea/coffee. Only problem for me was noise of air conditioning at night- wakened me off and on but my wife slept OK; got used to it after couple of nights. Pretty central to everything-20 minutes walk to Union Sq shopping area and 15-20min bus to Fishermans Wharf. Bus outside door. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Excellent hotel for the price, would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Ok, to start, for those people who have written negative reviews - realize that this is NOT a 5 star hotel. Obviously they do not have that service level. However, for the price, I am not sure you could beat the Opal Hotel. We stayed there from March 10-20th for a vacation and had a wonderful time. The hotel is clean, in good condition, and the staff are incredibly courteous and professional. I did not find a single problem as far as cleanliness goes. The room was very nicely kept and the cleaning staff were friendly. The front desk staff were pretty knowledgeable and helpful on top of that. One day I asked for a map and the guy asked where we were going. When I told him, he suggested a different route to avoid an INCREDIBLY steep hill, for which I was grateful. Kind of an extra step he didn't have to take. Overall, great hotel for the price!

review.title: The Opal - A modest hotel for the price.
review.reviewText: The Opal is a very modest hotel located in San Fran. The location is good, there are lots of places to walk to and eat - including a good organic coffee shop about 4 blocks away. Don't stay at the Opal for the continential breakfast unless you have low expectations but otherwise it is fine for the price. The rooms are a bit small but I think that is probably expected for a big city, the cleaning service was good and the room was also clean.

review.title: Not a bad place to stay if you are only there for a couple days
review.reviewText: Hotel room was quite small but I liked the cable tv and free internet. The location of the hotel is not bad either. It is about 6 blocks away from Japantown and if you are OK with walking, Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown are within a mile and a half. I thought the surrounding environment of the hotel was pretty safe too. There is a movie theater right next to the hotel and downstaits has a hamburger restaurant with awesome milkshakes. The hotel itself looked pretty old but was not in terrible condition. I would recommend it if you are only going to stay for a couple days, but not for a long time.

review.title: Great Location, Area Not So bad
review.reviewText: True it's on the edge of the seedy area... O'Farrell Theater is on the next block, but you can walk anywhere safely. The homeless are evrywhere but don't get up in your grill. No nastiness if you say no to the panhandlers. We walked to Union Square, Haight Street, Fisherman's Wharf... but my wife and I are a bit obssessive about walking :-) We paid $25/hotel stay day (which saves you a day from the parking across the street which goes on the clock and restarts when you go out and back) which allowed in and out parking. Bring cash for the parking, they don't accept debit cards, and you MUST have a credit card for incidentals, again no debit allowed. Room was small, king size bed was firm. Functional with upgraded bathrooms (our King room had shower only). Very good maid service. Step back in time for a decent price. Best things... Mel's next door where they serve an actual great rare hamburger and Tommy's Joynt across the street where the food is also very good. Starbucks everywhere and a Tully's coffee a few blocks up (superior to Starbuck's IMHO).A few blocks up the hill are posh restaurants. Arts and culture a few blocks down. We enjoyed ourselves and this hotel was a good place to crash!

review.title: A great value
review.reviewText: Excellent quality and service for a good, modest price.

review.title: great hotel for the $$
review.reviewText: THe front desk was great! They answered all questions. And honestly! The room was small but I crashed there so as long as you are not spending lots of time(and being in San Fran Why would you?) it was perfect! Not too far but did have to walk. Good exercise. Mels was good for breakfast, along with the Continental @ the hotel. I wouls stay there again and probably will with a daughter on her way to the Art Academy.

review.title: best value hotel
review.reviewText: My Wife and I were most impressed with the value for money and helpful staff. The hotel fully lives up to its 3star, maybe more. Its position on van ness av is perfect to find it and get to and from airports and around town. Its in a quality area just up from the magnificent city hall. Mercedes and Bently car show rooms. Mels diner attached to hotel is really convenient.basement carpark is good and secure but perhaps a bit pricey at $28/night but hotel is cheap.

review.title: Noisy air conditioners, slow internet
review.reviewText: Just an OK hotel. Small rooms, cramped and oddly-arranged bathrooms, the air conditioners are noisy (water flows in their pipes) even when turned off. 5 pillows + 2 decorative pillows just take up too much space. Breakfast is lackluster with stale bagels, cereal and cheap coffee. The most annoying: the free "high-speed" Internet connection is restricted to 256Kbps, and has frequent hiccups.

review.title: Unexpected Gem!
review.reviewText: This hotel has a decent location with proximity to main bus lines along Van Ness and Geary/O'Farrell. Also, the food is good with Mel's connected right to the building and the unique Tommy's Joynt across the street (Must try the ribs!!!) If you like movies, there is an AMC 15 theatre next door too. It was very clean with a colonial style that made it feel very different than the mass produced chains out there. I was surprised at the generous size of the bathroom! The service was wonderful with great advice for the traveler from the front desk as well as a tasty continental breakfast to get you started. To top if off, I had left a book behind in the room so I called housekeeping to see if they found it. Turns out they did and they mailed it back to me at my home halfway across the country! AND I received it the NEXT DAY! I was delighted with this stay and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good price on a hotel that isn't your typical carbon copy experience.

review.title: Good Place to be
review.reviewText: Hi When you are there for short trip, its a good place to be, they provide you with all the services required and at the best possible cost. Centrally located and easily accessible. I will defintely use them whenever I go to SFO.

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: clean, affordable, comfortable, and accessable. what more do yu need

review.title: Pleasant Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very accommodating, hotel had been recently renovated.. and everything was very clean......It had a good location and we could walk to many places that we wished to go to.....The parking was very secure.....we also enjoyed the porximity to Polk St.

review.title: Great stay for a short period of time
review.reviewText: The service of the hotel was great. Great place to stay for a weekend or just few days. Breakfast was good enough for a day jump start. The location of the hotel is far from everything I recommmend staying near Union Square.

review.title: Diamond in the Rough
review.reviewText: The hotel front is directly off of the sidewalk with no main grand entrance, so it doesn't look overly inviting. However, once inside and in one of the rooms the comfort level is fantastic and the decor is pleasing. I didd't want to leave the room much. The beds are comfortable and the hotel has most of the ammineties one looks for. The overall appearance is great. This is a very comfortable and modern hotel. The cost was very fair and the service was not below average. The Opal is a great place to stay if one visit's San Francisco, that's why it was my second time as a guest!

review.title: it will due.
review.reviewText: Nice lobby, hotel was descent. Bathroom in room was very nice, a little small but nice. Room was average, felt clean at least. At that price it was better then some of the other ones i have stayed in similar price range.

review.title: Excellent Choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Room was very comfortable, clean, great bed, good bathroom. This is a well maintained Hotel, and the "Price is Right". The free breakfast was basic, but just enough to get you started in the morning. Location is good as public transportation is right outside the door.

review.title: good enough
review.reviewText: not bad for the price, it could have been cleaner

review.title: We'd stay here again...
review.reviewText: This hotel turned out to be nicer than we had anticipated. It was clean, we felt safe, and it was located within a mile of every place we needed and wanted to visit. The bathroom vanity area was ridiculously small, especially for two women trying to get ready to go out. The continental breakfast was nice, allowing us to have a good start to a great day in the city.

review.title: Good Price for Location
review.reviewText: We were there on December 30th. The rate was great for that time of year in the city. We went to a concert at Bill Graham and were close enough to walk (1/2 mile) - although the surrounding area is not great, we never felt in danger. Parking was the biggest concern - no valet and very stressful checking in when you have to park on busy Van Ness - parking lot was hard to find and we were assigned to a spot # that didn't exist & had to go thru process all over again.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: ok for its price

review.title: A Good Value
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean, big and comfortable.

review.title: Looking forward next time
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and nice. Staff were friendly and courteous. Free breakfast and high speed internet is a plus. Food and entertainment not a problem. Will come back next time

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms are nice, with soundproof windows and little or no noise between rooms. More installation around the door would be a nice improvement. Lots of foreigners and airline personnel use this hotel.

review.title: Good hotel, bad location
review.reviewText: We LOVED our hotel room, but it is located in the tenderloin district... and is not the best part of town. I would go back if it was in a better location.

review.title: confortable stay
review.reviewText: Confortable place to stay for vacation. Perfect for resting and relaxing after an exhausting day. Room rates were fair in comparison to other hotels. My family and I were very satisfied with your accomodations that we came back home and talked to our friends and family members how wonderful our stay was at your facility. Thank-you for making our stay confortable.

review.title: Not a place for car parking
review.reviewText: It was hard to find the entrance of garage. In front of garage, there were a few homeless. In my room, network did not work and hair dryer did not work due to the loose electrical contact in wall consent. They asked me to move my car to a different lot. Garage opening switch did not work at that time. So I worked to the front desk to ask garage opening about 300ft. When returning to a car, a drunken homeless followed me with shouting. It was scary. So I do not recommend here for the traveller with a car.

review.title: Very impressive with the outcome
review.reviewText: Room rates and service are excellent

review.title: Great for that price
review.reviewText: Our hotel room was very clean, the bed comfortable, with good quality sheets. Bathroom looked newly-remodeled, very nice. Too bad no sitting area, just a desk, in the room. However, we booked a room with king size bed, but only got a queen. During this trip I learned that Expedia doesn't guarantee many things. The hotel has a complimentary breakfast, that was very convenient. The parking is conveniently within the hotel, and you get an assigned space, except we got a space right below some pigeons' favorite spot, so after two days my car needed a wash badly.

review.title: NIce Hotel
review.reviewText: Over the years I have been too many hotels ranging from three to four stars throught-out the United States, however, this hotel was very nice and the complimentay breakfast was great.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Old, felt like the carpets hadn't been cleaned in a long while.

review.title: Bad neighborhood
review.reviewText: Looking out our window were drug dealers and people sleeping in doorways. Bad area. Hotel room was noisy because of the large vent for the air system.Runs 24-7. 2 star hotel

review.title: Good value and location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located within walking distance, or inexpensive cab ride, to Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, etc. and was a good value for a chain in a major city. Tip: look for the "Cars Park Free" type package as it saved us ~$30 day for parking! The breakfast was decent but crowded, and the room was comfortable for the limited amount of time we spent in it. The head desk attendant was horribly rude at check-in, but the rest of the personnel we dealt with were much nicer. If you are on a budget, or want to spend your money in the multitude of awesome restaurants instead of on the hotel, this is a great deal.

review.title: Great Customer Service, Breakfast, Room!
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel after a last minute change as we were told the area we were due to stay in (civic centre) was dangerous and it was not recommended that we stayed there. We are really pleased we changed! We arrived at this hotel really early in the morning, at 6am and the lady in reception allowed us to check in early without charge and even let us have breakfast. This is unheard of to us!! We were really pleased with our room, it had everything we needed and the hotel provide free high-speed internet access in all the rooms and also in the lobby. The breakfast was better than we've had anywhere so far in america, bagels, toast, waffles, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, etc. Its all you can eat and is more than enough to start off your day. The location of the hotel is away from the bad area, and its on a bus route and is close to the cable cars too. Its really easy to get around SF. Everyone always comments on the homeless, but they are everywhere in SF, you cant avoid them. The street this hotel is situated on is busy, well lit and i would consider it safe. The staff were always really helpful and friendly to us. We'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Consider this hotel for your budget choice
review.reviewText: It's overall normal hotel for those stars and price it has. Yet by no means agree to stay in the room #220 or other #20 rooms in different floors as it faces a huge double-ventilator airconditioner's compressor which is right next to the window of this room. The device produces round o'clock horrible and unbearable noise. We spent just one sleepless and restless night in this room and then was relocated to room #312 facing Van Ness street which was much better in terms of quietness. I don't no how the hotel management dare to offer such a torture room as #220 at all. Besides the hotel cleaning ladies are very noisy. Also consider a huge crowd in breakfast hours, which is specifically present in weekends.

review.title: Very helpful staff
review.reviewText: Staff exceedingly helpul Also conveniently located on bus line.

review.title: Old but good
review.reviewText: Honesty, chip and comfortable

review.title: Very Good for the price
review.reviewText: My opinion is that the hotel is a very good alternative (and affordable) if you want to be near "everything" in San Francisco. The only thing I will suggest to the management is that they should provide more security, specially for the people that are using the parking provided by the hotel, which on a street on one of the sides of the hotel.

review.title: Problem wouldn't keep me away
review.reviewText: The hallway was freezing because an automatic door to the exterior would not close completely. This made the hallway and our room uncomfortably cold. However, the room was very clean (including the bathroom) and comfortable (except for the temperature). The breakfast was ample for an average eater, and the front desk staff was very knowledgable regarding various sites to visit during out stay (which was during December).

review.title: nice breakfast
review.reviewText: make waffle myself!

review.title: i will never come back
review.reviewText: very bad serice in the front desk/registration from checking in and checking out

review.title: Better than I thought
review.reviewText: I'm always worried when I reserve rooms online, but having seen the hotel from the outside (and it didn't appear too shabby), we decided to take a shot. The room was clean and we were very happy with our service. The location was great...central to all the places we wanted to visit. To top it all off, the rates were great.

review.title: not the best, but definitely not the worst
review.reviewText: This hotel's location is what makes it good. Van Ness is US 101, a wide boulevard lined with shops, restaurants, bars and the occassional hotel. We chose this one because we had read bad things about the Civic Center area regarding it being dead at night with nothing but homeless people, so this was the other reasonably-priced alternative. This turned out to be true, as we saw later. Although not on a BART, streetcar or MUNI rail line, there are several buses that go to points of interest. The room was smaller than I had anticipated, but the high-speed internet (wired) was really nice, the full cable TV (but no pay stations) was also appreciated. Complaints: - The small bathroom was a little annoying, as you couldn't really lean into the sink. - The maid stopped filling the towels for a couple of days (she left clean ones, but not as many as we had had before), although she may have been mad after my friend broke a hotel glass in the bathroom. - This is an old building, so the layout is pretty quirky, with two elevators and stairwells in strange places. The room was also a bit drafty. - The free breakfast, although good, was set up in a tiny room off of the lobby and was packed after about 8am. - Our room was next to the fire escape. It was a little too cold to enjoy it, and it blocked what otherwise would have been a nice view of the busy street corner. All in all, I was satisfied for what I paid, although I paid much less than the room was advertised for.

review.title: Not overly impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel served the purpose but was in a bit of a sketchy area of the city, especially at night. We got the package including parking which said it came with a King size bed, but when we got to the hotel, they said all packages only come with Queen so that was disappointing.

review.title: Pleasant experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely remodeled. The service was great. We happened to be there on the last Friday of the month in Oct. so got to see the bike parade of costumed riders on Van Ness. Neighbor's bathroom a bit hard noisy in the morning, but overall a very pleasant experience.

review.title: Very conviently located for tourists.
review.reviewText: Old, but nicely renovated and maintained. Contintental breakfast is mediocre, but otherwise, was satisfied.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: We stayed just one night, but I have to say that this hotel is really great because of it's location to everything downtown, we were right in the middle of everything! Everything was very clean, although there was some smoke residue from previous ppl who smoked. That was quickly taken care of by opening the windows. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Be sure to get up early, because breakfast gets crowded.

review.title: Central location, on site secure parking, versatile continental breakfast, quiet, clean rooms
review.reviewText: La Quinta downtown is very centrally located. It is very easy to access public transportation from this hotel. We purchased a Muni public transportation pass and we were able to get to all the sites very easily. The double paned windows in the rooms made the rooms very quiet. The continental breakfast was versatile and more than sufficient to start the day. Parking was on site and secure. Hotel staff was helpful and the rooms were clean. The rooms were a little small, but the walk in closet was helpful to store luggage. We had never booked a room utilizing the internet before and we were very satisfied with La Quinta. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Not as good as I had expected
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, but seemed old and rundown. The rooms were small, but clean. The hotel was very quiet, in spite of its location on a busy street. The food on the buffet breakfast was tired and low budget - not very appealing. I decided to skip breakfast. My biggest issue was the location of the hotel. The neighborhood is quite rundown and there are a lot of street people hanging around. I definitely would not feel comfortable walking in the neighborhood around the hotel at night.

review.title: We love San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This older hotel has been nicely remodeled and very centrally located. We had a city pass and several bus lines were available just across the street. Took the bus several blocks to California cable car line that went up to Nob Hill and to Chinatown. Took the bus back to the hotel after the ballet at 11p.m Breakfast was included every morning at the hotel. Piano player in the late afternoon. Every employee was very friendly. Very impressed!

review.title: Cute Place
review.reviewText: This hotel was good minus a few things characteristic of an old building. The heat was not adjustable and our room was very warm.  The bathroom door almost got me locked inside the bathroom as well.  The place was historic with great charm and the service was excellent.

review.title: Great location, convenient to everything
review.reviewText:
Excellent location, walking distance to City Hall, Opera, California cable car line.  Busses 47 & 49 right on Van Ness to whisk you downtown or to harbor area.  Great breakfasts.
Mels' Drive In located next door.  Offering excellent food at
reasonable prices.

review.title: Very impressive  for the price
review.reviewText: We were impressed, this inn had recently been remodeled.  Very good location, 5 minute walk to union square & china town.  Very clean and comfortable.  Not very noisy considering the location on a busy street.  Easy method of city bus transportation right on Van Ness Street.  We would recommend this hotel to everyone. Good value for the price.

review.title: Great moderate hotel
review.reviewText: We were pleased that this hotel was so nice!  Not luxurious, but very nice for the price we paid! The location was perfect for us, as we were in San Francisco for a couple of shows at the Great American Music Hall -- which was just around the corner and a block and a half away.  Also, not a bad walk to Union Square.  We were very pleasantly surprised with this hotel, and would recommend it to anyone who needs to stay in this area of town.

review.title: Good location, good stay
review.reviewText: The location is good. Bus stop is within one block. The bus route is frequent and easy to transfer to most attractions. The street in front of the hotel is bright and busy at night. So I feel quite safe. Restarants are within walking distance. The room is pretty big and clean. We didn't hear any noise although our room faces the Van Don(?) street. The price is not that low, but it is reasonable. By the way, the breakfast is very good.
